23.Abdel Haleem: Your Lord has commanded that you should worship none but Him, and that you be kind to your parents. If either or both of them reach old age with you, say no word that shows impatience with them, and do not be harsh with them, but speak to them respectfully

24.Abdel Haleem: and lower your wing in humility towards them in kindness and say, ‘Lord, have mercy on them, just as they cared for me when I was little.’

25.Abdel Haleem: Your Lord knows best what is in your heart. If you are good, He is most forgiving to those who return to Him

26.Abdel Haleem: Give relatives their due, and the needy, and travellers- do not squander your wealth wastefully

27.Abdel Haleem: those who squander are the brothers of Satan, and Satan is most ungrateful to his Lord

28.Abdel Haleem: but if, while seeking some bounty that you expect from your Lord, you turn them down, then at least speak some word of comfort to them

29.Abdel Haleem: Do not be tight-fisted, nor so open-handed that you end up blamed and overwhelmed with regret

30.Abdel Haleem: Your Lord gives abundantly to whoever He will, and sparingly to whoever He will: He knows and observes His servants thoroughly

31.Abdel Haleem: Do not kill your children for fear of poverty––We shall provide for them and for you––killing them is a great sin

32.Abdel Haleem: And do not go anywhere near adultery: it is an outrage, and an evil path

33.Abdel Haleem: Do not take life, which God has made sacred, except by right: if anyone is killed wrongfully, We have given authority to the defender of his rights, but he should not be excessive in taking life, for he is already aided [by God]

34.Abdel Haleem: Do not go near the orphan’s property, except with the best [intentions], until he reaches the age of maturity. Honour your pledges: you will be questioned about your pledges

35.Abdel Haleem: Give full measure when you measure, and weigh with accurate scales: that is better and fairer in the end

36.Abdel Haleem: Do not follow blindly what you do not know to be true: ears, eyes, and heart, you will be questioned about all these

37.Abdel Haleem: Do not strut arrogantly about the earth: you cannot break it open, nor match the mountains in height

38.Abdel Haleem: The evil of all these actions is hateful to your Lord

39.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], this is some of the wisdom your Lord has revealed to you: do not set up another god beside God, or you will be thrown into Hell, blamed and rejected

40.Abdel Haleem: What? Has your Lord favoured you people with sons and taken daughters for Himself from the angels?What a monstrous thing for you to say

41.Abdel Haleem: We have explained things in various ways in this Quran, so that such people might take notice, but it has only turned them further away

42.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘If there were other gods along with Him, as they say there are, then they would have tried to find a way to the Lord of the Throne.’

43.Abdel Haleem: Glory to Him! He is far above what they say

44.Abdel Haleem: The seven heavens and the earth and everyone in them glorify Him. There is not a single thing that does not celebrate His praise, though you do not understand their praise: He is most forbearing, most forgiving

45.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], when you recite the Quran, We put an invisible barrier between you and those who do not believe in the life to come

46.Abdel Haleem: We have put covers on their hearts that prevent them from understanding it, and heaviness in their ears. When you mention your Lord in the Quran, and Him alone, they turn their backs and run away

47.Abdel Haleem: We know best the way they listen, when they listen to you and when they confer in secret, and these wrongdoers say, ‘You are only following a man who is bewitched.’

48.Abdel Haleem: See what they think you are like! But they are lost and cannot find the right way

49.Abdel Haleem: They also say, ‘What? When we are turned to bones and dust, shall we really be raised up in a new act of creation?’

50.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘[Yes] even if you were [as hard as] stone, or iron

51.Abdel Haleem: or any other substance you think hard to bring to life.’ Then they will say, ‘Who will bring us back?’ Say, ‘The One who created you the first time.’ Then they will shake their heads at you and say, ‘When will that be?’ Say, ‘It may well be very soon

52.Abdel Haleem: it will be the Day when He calls you, and you answer by praising Him, and you think you have stayed [on earth] only a little while.’

53.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], tell My servants to say what is best. Satan sows discord among them: Satan is a sworn enemy of man

54.Abdel Haleem: Your Lord has the most knowledge about all of you: if He pleases He will have mercy on you, and if He pleases He will punish you. [Prophet], We did not send you to take charge of them

55.Abdel Haleem: Your Lord knows best about everyone in the heavens and the earth. We gave some prophets more than others: We gave David a book [of Psalms]

56.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘Call upon those you claim to be deities beside God: they have no power to remove or avert any harm from you.’

57.Abdel Haleem: Those [angels] they pray to are themselves seeking a way to their Lord, even those who are closest to Him. They hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. The punishment of your Lord is much to be feared

58.Abdel Haleem: there is no community We shall not destroy, or punish severely, before the Day of Resurrection- this is written in the Book

59.Abdel Haleem: Nothing prevents Us from sending miraculous signs, except the fact that previous peoples denied them. We gave the people of Thamud the she-camel as a clear sign, yet they maltreated it. We send signs only to give warning

60.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], We have told you that your Lord knows all about human beings. The vision We showed you was only a test for people, as was the cursed tree [mentioned] in the Quran. We warn them, but this only increases their insolence

61.Abdel Haleem: When We said to the angels, ‘Bow down before Adam,’ they all bowed down, but not Iblis. He retorted, ‘Why should I bow down to someone You have created out of clay?’

62.Abdel Haleem: and [then] said, ‘You see this being You have honoured above me? If You reprieve me until the Day of Resurrection, I will lead all but a few of his descendants by the nose.’

63.Abdel Haleem: God said, ‘Go away! Hell will be your reward, and the reward of any of them who follow you- an ample reward

64.Abdel Haleem: Rouse whichever of them you can with your voice, muster your cavalry and infantry against them, share their wealth and their children with them, and make promises to them- Satan promises them nothing but delusion

65.Abdel Haleem: but you will have no authority over My [true] servants: Your Lord can take care of them well enough.’

66.Abdel Haleem: [People], it is your Lord who makes ships go smoothly for you on the sea so that you can seek His bounty: He is most merciful towards you

67.Abdel Haleem: When you get into distress at sea, those you pray to besides Him desert you, but when He brings you back safe to land you turn away: man is ever ungrateful

68.Abdel Haleem: Can you be sure that God will not have you swallowed up into the earth when you are back on land, or that He will not send a sandstorm against you? Then you will find no one to protect you

69.Abdel Haleem: Or can you be sure that He will not send you back out to sea, and send a violent storm against you to drown you for being so ungrateful? You will find no helper against Us there

70.Abdel Haleem: We have honoured the children of Adam and carried them by land and sea; We have provided good sustenance for them and favoured them specially above many of those We have created

71.Abdel Haleem: On the Day when We summon each community, along with its leader, those who are given their record in their right hand will read it [with pleasure]. But no one will be wronged in the least

72.Abdel Haleem: those who were blind in this life will be blind in the Hereafter, and even further off the path

73.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], the disbelievers tried to tempt you away from what We revealed to you, so that you would invent some other revelation and attribute it to Us and then they would have taken you as a friend

74.Abdel Haleem: If We had not made you stand firm, you would almost have inclined a little towards them

75.Abdel Haleem: In that case, We would have made you taste a double punishment in this life, and a double punishment after death and then you would have found no one to help you against Us

76.Abdel Haleem: They planned to scare you off the land, but they would not have lasted for more than a little while after you

77.Abdel Haleem: Such was Our way with the messengers We sent before you, and you will find no change in Our ways

78.Abdel Haleem: So perform the regular prayers in the period from the time the sun is past its zenith till the darkness of the night, and [recite] the Quran at dawn- dawn recitation is always witnessed–&ndash

79.Abdel Haleem: and dur-ing the night wake up and pray, as an extra offering of your own, so that your Lord may raise you to a [highly] praised status

80.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘My Lord, make me go in truthfully, and come out truthfully, and grant me supporting authority from You.’

81.Abdel Haleem: And say, ‘The truth has come, and falsehood has passed away: falsehood is bound to pass away.’

82.Abdel Haleem: We send down the Quran as healing and mercy to those who believe; as for those who disbelieve, it only increases their loss

83.Abdel Haleem: When We favour man he turns arrogantly to one side, but when harm touches him, he falls into despair

84.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘Everyone does things their own way, but your Lord is fully aware of who follows the best-guided path.’

85.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], they ask you about the Spirit. Say, ‘The Spirit is part of my Lord’s domain. You have only been given a little knowledge.’

86.Abdel Haleem: If We pleased, We could take away what We have revealed to you- then you would find no one to plead for you against Us

87.Abdel Haleem: if it were not for your Lord’s mercy: His favour to you has been truly great

88.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘Even if all mankind and jinn came together to produce something like this Quran, they could not produce anything like it, however much they helped each other.’

89.Abdel Haleem: In this Quran, We have set out all kinds of examples for people, yet most of them persist in disbelieving

90.Abdel Haleem: They say, ‘We will not believe for you [Muhammad] until you make a spring gush out of the ground for us

91.Abdel Haleem: or until you have a garden of date palms and vines, and make rivers pour through them

92.Abdel Haleem: or make the sky fall on us in pieces, as you claimed will happen; or bring God and the angels before us face to face

93.Abdel Haleem: or have a house made of gold; or ascend into the sky- even then, we will not believe in your ascension until you send a real book down for us to read.’ Say, ‘Glory be to my Lord! Am I anything but a mortal, a messenger?’

94.Abdel Haleem: The only thing that kept these people from believing, when guidance came to them, was that they said, ‘How could God have sent a human being as a messenger?’

95.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘If there were angels walking about on earth, feeling at home, We would have sent them an angel from Heaven as a messenger.’

96.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘God is witness enough between me and you. He knows and observes His servants well.’

97.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], anyone God guides is truly guided, and you will find no protector other than Him for anyone He leaves astray. On the Day of Resurrection We shall gather them, lying on their faces, blind, dumb, and deaf. Hell will be their Home. Whenever the Fire goes down, We shall make it blaze more fiercely for them

98.Abdel Haleem: This is what they will get for rejecting Our signs and saying, ‘What? When we are turned to bones and dust, how can we be raised in a new act of creation?’

99.Abdel Haleem: Do they not see that God, who created the heavens and earth, can create the likes of them [anew]? He has ordained a time for them- there is no doubt about that- but the evildoers refuse everything except disbelief

100.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘If you possessed the very stores of my Lord’s bounty, you would hold them back in your fear of spending: man is ever grudging.’

101.Abdel Haleem: In the past, We gave Moses nine clear signs- ask the Children of Israel. When Moses came to [the Egyptians], Pharaoh said to him, ‘Moses, I think you are bewitched.’

102.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘You know very well that only the Lord of the heavens and earth could have sent these signs as clear proof. I think that you, Pharaoh, are doomed.’

103.Abdel Haleem: So he wanted to wipe them off the [face of the] earth, but We drowned him and those with him

104.Abdel Haleem: After his death, We told the Children of Israel, ‘Live in the land, and when the promise of the Hereafter is fulfilled, We shall bring you to the assembly of all people.’

105.Abdel Haleem: We sent down the Quran with the truth, and with the truth it has come down- [Prophet], We sent you only to give good news and warning

106.Abdel Haleem: it is a recitation that We have revealed in parts, so that you can recite it to people at intervals; We have sent it down little by little

107.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘Whether you believe it or not, those who were given knowledge earlier fall down on their faces when it is recited to them

108.Abdel Haleem: and say, “Glory to our Lord! Our Lord’s promise has been fulfilled.”

109.Abdel Haleem: They fall down on their faces, weeping, and [the Quran] increases their humility.’

110.Abdel Haleem: Say [to them], ‘Call on God, or on the Lord of Mercy- whatever names you call Him, the best names belong to Him.’ [Prophet], do not be too loud in your prayer, or too quiet, but seek a middle wa

111.Abdel Haleem: and say, ‘Praise belongs to God, who has no child nor partner in His rule. He is not so weak as to need a protector. Proclaim His limitless greatness!’

1.Abdel Haleem: Praise be to God, who sent down the Scripture to His servant and made it unerringly straight

2.Abdel Haleem: warning of severe punishment from Him, and [giving] glad news to the believers who do good deeds––an excellent rewar

3.Abdel Haleem: that they will always enjoy

4.Abdel Haleem: It warns those people who assert, ‘God has offspring.’

5.Abdel Haleem: They have no knowledge about this, nor did their forefathers––it is a monstrous assertion that comes out of their mouths: what they say is nothing but lies

6.Abdel Haleem: But [Prophet] are you going to worry yourself to death over them if they do not believe in this message

7.Abdel Haleem: We have adorned the earth with attractive things so that We may test people to find out which of them do best

8.Abdel Haleem: but We shall reduce all this to barren dust

9.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], do you find the Companions in the Cave and al-Raqim so wondrous, among all Our other signs

10.Abdel Haleem: When the young men sought refuge in the cave and said, ‘Our Lord, grant us Your mercy, and find us a good way out of our ordeal,’

11.Abdel Haleem: We sealed their ears [with sleep] in the cave for years

12.Abdel Haleem: Then We woke them so that We could make clear which of the two parties was better able to work out how long they had been there

13.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], We shall tell you their story as it really was. They were young men who believed in their Lord, and We gave them more and more guidance

14.Abdel Haleem: We gave strength to their hearts when they stood up and said, ‘Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and earth. We shall never call upon any god other than Him, for that would be an outrageous thing to do

15.Abdel Haleem: These people of ours have taken gods other than Him. Why do they not produce clear evidence about them? Who could be more unjust than someone who makes up lies about God

16.Abdel Haleem: Now that you have left such people, and what they worshipped instead of God, take refuge in the cave. God will shower His mercy on you and make you an easy way out of your ordeal.’

17.Abdel Haleem: You could have seen the [light of the] sun as it rose, moving away to the right of their cave, and when it set, moving away to the left of them, while they lay in the wide space inside the cave. (This is one of God’s signs: those people God guides are rightly guided, but you will find no protector to lead to the right path those He leaves to stray.

18.Abdel Haleem: You would have thought they were awake, though they lay asleep. We turned them over, to the right and the left, with their dog stretching out its forelegs at the entrance. If you had seen them, you would have turned and run away, filled with fear of them

19.Abdel Haleem: In time We woke them, and they began to question one another. One of them asked, ‘How long have you been here?’ and [some] answered, ‘A day or part of a day,’ but then [others] said, ‘Your Lord knows best how long you have been here. One of you go to the city with your silver coins, find out where the best food is there, and bring some back. But be careful not to let anyone know about you

20.Abdel Haleem: if they found you out, they would stone you or force you to return to their religion, where you would never come to any good.’

21.Abdel Haleem: In this way We brought them to people’s attention so that they might know that God’s promise [of resurrection] is true and that there is no doubt about the Last Hour, [though] people argue among themselves. [Some] said, ‘Construct a building over them: their Lord knows best about them.’ Those who prevailed said, ‘We shall build a place of worship over them.’

22.Abdel Haleem: [Some] say, ‘The sleepers were three, and their dog made four,’ others say, ‘They were five, and the dog made six’- guessing in the dark- and some say, ‘They were seven, and their dog made eight.’ Say [Prophet], ‘My Lord knows best how many they were.’ Only a few have real knowledge about them, so do not argue, but stick to what is clear, and do not ask any of these people about them

23.Abdel Haleem: do not say of anything, ‘I will do that tomorrow,’

24.Abdel Haleem: without adding, ‘God willing,’ and, whenever you forget, remember your Lord and say, ‘May my Lord guide me closer to what is right.’

25.Abdel Haleem: [Some say], ‘The sleepers stayed in their cave for three hundred years,’ some added nine more

26.Abdel Haleem: Say [Prophet], ‘God knows best how long they stayed.’ His is the knowledge of all that is hidden in the heavens and earth- How well He sees! How well He hears!- and they have no one to protect them other than Him; He does not allow anyone to share His rule

27.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], follow what has been revealed to you of your Lord’s Scripture: there is no changing His words, nor can you find any refuge except with Him

28.Abdel Haleem: Content yourself with those who pray to their Lord morning and evening, seeking His approval, and do not let your eyes turn away from them out of desire for the attractions of this worldly life: do not yield to those whose hearts We have made heedless of Our Quran, those who follow their own low desires, those whose ways are unbridled

29.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘Now the truth has come from your Lord: let those who wish to believe in it do so, and let those who wish to reject it do so.’ We have prepared a Fire for the wrongdoers that will envelop them from all sides. If they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like molten metal, scalding their faces. What a terrible drink! What a painful resting place

30.Abdel Haleem: As for those who believe and do good deeds- We do not let the reward of anyone who does a good deed go to waste

31.Abdel Haleem: they will have Gardens of lasting bliss graced with flowing streams. There they will be adorned with bracelets of gold. There they will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade. There they will be comfortably seated on soft chairs. What a blessed reward! What a pleasant resting place

32.Abdel Haleem: Tell them the parable of two men: for one of them We made two gardens of grape vines, surrounded them with date palms, and put corn fields in between

33.Abdel Haleem: both gardens yielded fruit and did not fail in any way; We made a stream flow through them

34.Abdel Haleem: and so he had abundant fruit. One day, while talking to his friend, he said, ‘I have more wealth and a larger following than you.’

35.Abdel Haleem: He went into his garden and wronged himself by saying, ‘I do not think this will ever perish

36.Abdel Haleem: or that the Last Hour will ever come- even if I were to be taken back to my Lord, I would certainly find something even better there.’

37.Abdel Haleem: His companion retorted, ‘Have you no faith in Him who created you from dust, from a small drop of fluid, then shaped you into a man

38.Abdel Haleem: But, for me, He is God, my Lord, and I will never set up any partner with Him

39.Abdel Haleem: If only, when you entered your garden, you had said, “This is God’s will. There is no power not [given] by God.” Although you see I have less wealth and offspring than you

40.Abdel Haleem: my Lord may well give me something better than your garden, and send thunderbolts on your garden from the sky, so that it becomes a heap of barren dust

41.Abdel Haleem: or its water may sink so deep into the ground that you will never be able to reach it again.’

42.Abdel Haleem: And so it was: his fruit was completely destroyed, and there he was, wringing his hands over what he had invested in it, as it drooped on its trellises, and saying, ‘I wish I had not set up any partner to my Lord.’

43.Abdel Haleem: He had no forces to help him other than God- he could not even help himself

44.Abdel Haleem: In that situation, the only protection is that of God, the True God: He gives the best rewards and the best outcome

45.Abdel Haleem: Tell them, too, what the life of this world is like: We send water down from the skies and the earth’s vegetation absorbs it, but soon the plants turn to dry stubble scattered about by the wind: God has power over everything

46.Abdel Haleem: Wealth and children are the attractions of this worldly life, but lasting good works have a better reward with your Lord and give better grounds for hope

47.Abdel Haleem: One day We shall make the mountains move, and you will see the earth as an open plain. We shall gather all people together, leaving no one

48.Abdel Haleem: They will be lined up before your Lord: ‘Now you have come to Us as We first created you, although you claimed We had not made any such appointment for you.’

49.Abdel Haleem: The record of their deeds will be laid open and you will see the guilty, dismayed at what they contain, saying, ‘Woe to us! What a record this is! It does not leave any deed, small or large, unaccounted for!’ They will find everything they ever did laid in front of them: your Lord will not be unjust to anyone

50.Abdel Haleem: We said to the angels, ‘Bow down before Adam,’ and they all bowed down, but not Iblis: he was one of the jinn and he disobeyed his Lord’s command. Are you [people] going to take him and his offspring as your masters instead of Me, even though they are your enemies? What a bad bargain for the evildoers

51.Abdel Haleem: I did not make them witnesses to the creation of the heavens and earth, nor to their own creation; I do not take as My supporters those who lead others astray

52.Abdel Haleem: On the Day God will say, ‘Call on those you claimed were My partners,’ they will call them but they will not answer; We shall set a deadly gulf between them

53.Abdel Haleem: The evildoers will see the Fire and they will realize that they are about to fall into it: they will find no escape from it

54.Abdel Haleem: In this Quran We have presented every kind of description for people but man is more contentious than any other creature

55.Abdel Haleem: Now that guidance has come to them, what stops these people believing and asking forgiveness from their Lord before the fate of earlier peoples annihilates them or their torment confronts them

56.Abdel Haleem: We only send messengers to bring good news and to deliver warning, yet the disbelievers seek to refute the truth with false arguments and make fun of My messages and warnings

57.Abdel Haleem: Who could be more wrong than the person who is reminded of his Lord’s messages and turns his back on them, ignoring what his hands are storing up for him [in the Hereafter]? We have put covers over their hearts, so they cannot understand the Quran, and We put heaviness in their ears: although you call them to guidance [Prophet] they will never accept it

58.Abdel Haleem: Your Lord is the Most Forgiving, and full of mercy: if He took them to task for the wrongs they have done, He would hasten their punishment on. They have an appointed time from which they will have no escape

59.Abdel Haleem: [just like] the former communities We destroyed for doing wrong: We set an appointed time for their destruction

60.Abdel Haleem: Moses said to his servant, ‘I will not rest until I reach the place where the two seas meet, even if it takes me years!’

61.Abdel Haleem: but when they reached the place where the two seas meet, they had forgotten all about their fish, which made its way into the sea and swam away

62.Abdel Haleem: They journeyed on, and then Moses said to his servant, ‘Give us our lunch! This journey of ours is very tiring,’

63.Abdel Haleem: and [the servant] said, ‘Remember when we were resting by the rock? I forgot the fish- Satan made me forget to pay attention to it- and it [must have] made its way into the sea.’ ‘How strange!’

64.Abdel Haleem: Moses said, ‘Then that was the place we were looking for.’ So the two turned back, retraced their footsteps

65.Abdel Haleem: and found one of Our servants- a man to whom We had granted Our mercy and whom We had given knowledge of Our own

66.Abdel Haleem: Moses said to him, ‘May I follow you so that you can teach me some of the right guidance you have been taught?’

67.Abdel Haleem: The man said, ‘You will not be able to bear with me patiently

68.Abdel Haleem: How could you be patient in matters beyond your knowledge?’

69.Abdel Haleem: Moses said, ‘God willing, you will find me patient. I will not disobey you in any way.’

70.Abdel Haleem: The man said, ‘If you follow me then, do not query anything I do before I mention it to you myself.’

71.Abdel Haleem: They travelled on. Later, when they got into a boat, and the man made a hole in it, Moses said, ‘How could you make a hole in it? Do you want to drown its passengers? What a strange thing to do!’

72.Abdel Haleem: He replied, ‘Did I not tell you that you would never be able to bear with me patiently?’

73.Abdel Haleem: Moses said, ‘Forgive me for forgetting. Do not make it too hard for me to follow you.’

74.Abdel Haleem: And so they travelled on. Then, when they met a young boy and the man killed him, Moses said, ‘How could you kill an innocent person? He has not killed anyone! What a terrible thing to do!’

75.Abdel Haleem: He replied, ‘Did I not tell you that you would never be able to bear with me patiently?’

76.Abdel Haleem: Moses said, ‘From now on, if I query anything you do, banish me from your company- you have put up with enough from me.’

77.Abdel Haleem: And so they travelled on. Then, when they came to a town and asked the inhabitants for food but were refused hospitality, they saw a wall there that was on the point of falling down and the man repaired it. Moses said, ‘But if you had wished you could have taken payment for doing that.’

78.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘This is where you and I part company. I will tell you the meaning of the things you could not bear with patiently

79.Abdel Haleem: the boat belonged to some needy people who made their living from the sea and I damaged it because I knew that coming after them was a king who was seizing every [serviceable] boat by force

80.Abdel Haleem: The young boy had parents who were people of faith, and so, fearing he would trouble them through wickedness and disbelief

81.Abdel Haleem: we wished that their Lord should give them another child- purer and more compassionate- in his place

82.Abdel Haleem: The wall belonged to two young orphans in the town and there was buried treasure beneath it belonging to them. Their father had been a righteous man, so your Lord intended them to reach maturity and then dig up their treasure as a mercy from your Lord. I did not do [these things] of my own accord: these are the explanations for those things you could not bear with patience.’

83.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], they ask you about Dhu ’l-Qarnayn. Say, ‘I will tell you something about him.’

84.Abdel Haleem: We established his power in the land, and gave him the means to achieve everything

85.Abdel Haleem: He travelled on a certain road

86.Abdel Haleem: then, when he came to the setting of the sun, he found it [seemed to be] setting into a muddy spring. Nearby he found some people and We said, ‘Dhu ’l-Qarnayn, you may choose [which of them] to punish or show kindness to.’

87.Abdel Haleem: He answered, ‘We shall punish those who have done evil, and when they are returned to their Lord He will punish them [even more] severely

88.Abdel Haleem: while those who believed and did good deeds will have the best of rewards: we shall command them to do what is easy for them.’

89.Abdel Haleem: He travelled on

90.Abdel Haleem: then, when he came to the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had provided no shelter from it

91.Abdel Haleem: And so it was: We knew all about him

92.Abdel Haleem: He travelled on

93.Abdel Haleem: then, when he reached a place between two mountain barriers, he found beside them a people who could barely understand him

94.Abdel Haleem: They said, ‘Dhu ’l-Qarnayn, Gog and Magog are ruining this land. Will you build a barrier between them and us if we pay you a tribute?’

95.Abdel Haleem: He answered, ‘The power my Lord has given me is better than any tribute, but if you lend me your strength, I will put up a fortification between you and them

96.Abdel Haleem: bring me lumps of iron!’ and then, when he had filled the gap between the two mountainsides [he said], ‘Work your bellows!’ and then, when he had made it glow like fire, he said, ‘Bring me molten metal to pour over it!’

97.Abdel Haleem: Their enemies could not scale the barrier, nor could they pierce it

98.Abdel Haleem: and he said, ‘This is a mercy from my Lord. But when my Lord’s promise is fulfilled, He will raze this barrier to the ground: my Lord’s promise always comes true.’

99.Abdel Haleem: On that Day, We shall let them surge against each other like waves and then the Trumpet will be blown and We shall gather them all together

100.Abdel Haleem: We shall show Hell to the disbelievers

101.Abdel Haleem: those whose eyes were blind to My signs, those who were unable to hear

102.Abdel Haleem: Did they think that they could take My servants as masters instead of Me? We have prepared Hell as the disbelievers’ resting place

103.Abdel Haleem: Say [Prophet], ‘Shall we tell you who has the most to lose by their actions

104.Abdel Haleem: whose efforts in this world are misguided, even when they think they are doing good work

105.Abdel Haleem: It is those who disbelieve in their Lord’s messages and deny that they will meet Him.’ Their deeds come to nothing: on the Day of Resurrection We shall give them no weight

106.Abdel Haleem: Their recompense for having disbelieved and made fun of My messages and My messengers will be Hell

107.Abdel Haleem: But those who believe and do good deeds will be given the Gardens of Paradise

108.Abdel Haleem: There they will remain, never wishing to leave

109.Abdel Haleem: Say [Prophet], ‘If the whole ocean were ink for writing the words of my Lord, it would run dry before those words were exhausted’- even if We were to add another ocean to it

110.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘I am only a human being, like you, to whom it has been revealed that your God is One. Anyone who fears to meet his Lord should do good deeds and give no one a share in the worship due to his Lord

1.Abdel Haleem: Kaf Ha Ya 'Ayn Sa

2.Abdel Haleem: This is an account of your Lord’s grace towards His servant, Zachariah

3.Abdel Haleem: when he called to his Lord secretly, saying

4.Abdel Haleem: ‘Lord, my bones have weakened and my hair is ashen grey, but never, Lord, have I ever prayed to You in vain

5.Abdel Haleem: I fear [what] my kinsmen [will do] when I am gone, for my wife is barren, so grant me a successor––a gift from You–&ndash

6.Abdel Haleem: to be my heir and the heir of the family of Jacob. Lord, make him well pleasing [to You].&rsquo

7.Abdel Haleem: ‘Zachariah, We bring you good news of a son whose name will be John––We have chosen this name for no one before him.’

8.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘Lord, how can I have a son when my wife is barren, and I am old and frail?’

9.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘This is what your Lord has said: “It is easy for Me: I created you, though you were nothing before.” ’

10.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘Give me a sign, Lord.’ He said, ‘Your sign is that you will not [be able to] speak to anyone for three full [days and] nights.’

11.Abdel Haleem: He went out of the sanctuary to his people and signalled to them to praise God morning and evening

12.Abdel Haleem: [We said], ‘John, hold on to the Scripture firmly.’ While he was still a boy, We granted him wisdom

13.Abdel Haleem: tenderness from Us, and purity. He was devout

14.Abdel Haleem: kind to his parents, not domineering or rebellious

15.Abdel Haleem: Peace was on him the day he was born, the day he died, and it will be on him the day he is raised to life again

16.Abdel Haleem: Mention in the Quran the story of Mary. She withdrew from her family to a place to the eas

17.Abdel Haleem: and secluded herself away; We sent Our Spirit to appear before her in the form of a perfected man

18.Abdel Haleem: She said, ‘I seek the Lord of Mercy’s protection against you: if you have any fear of Him [do not approach]!&rsquo

19.Abdel Haleem: but he said, ‘I am but a Mes-senger from your Lord, [come] to announce to you the gift of a pure son.’

20.Abdel Haleem: She said, ‘How can I have a son when no man has touched me? I have not been unchaste,’

21.Abdel Haleem: and he said, ‘This is what your Lord said: “It is easy for Me- We shall make him a sign to all people, a blessing from Us.”&rsquo

22.Abdel Haleem: And so it was ordained: she conceived him. She withdrew to a distant plac

23.Abdel Haleem: and, when the pains of childbirth drove her to [cling to] the trunk of a palm tree, she exclaimed, ‘I wish I had been dead and forgotten long before all this!’

24.Abdel Haleem: but a voice cried to her from below, ‘Do not worry: your Lord has provided a stream at your fee

25.Abdel Haleem: and, if you shake the trunk of the palm tree towards you, it will deliver fresh ripe dates for you

26.Abdel Haleem: so eat, drink, be glad, and say to anyone you may see: “I have vowed to the Lord of Mercy to abstain from conversation, and I will not talk to anyone today.”&rsquo

27.Abdel Haleem: She went back to her people carrying the child, and they said, ‘Mary! You have done something terrible

28.Abdel Haleem: Sister of Aaron! Your father was not an evil man; your mother was not unchaste!’

29.Abdel Haleem: She pointed at him. They said, ‘How can we converse with an infant?’

30.Abdel Haleem: [But] he said: ‘I am a servant of God. He has granted me the Scripture; made me a prophet

31.Abdel Haleem: made me blessed wherever I may be. He commanded me to pray, to give alms as long as I live

32.Abdel Haleem: to cherish my mother. He did not make me domineering or graceless

33.Abdel Haleem: Peace was on me the day I was born, and will be on me the day I die and the day I am raised to life again.’

34.Abdel Haleem: Such was Jesus, son of Mary. [This is] a statement of the Truth about which they are in doubt

35.Abdel Haleem: it would not befit God to have a child. He is far above that: when He decrees something, He says only, ‘Be,’ and it is

36.Abdel Haleem: ‘God is my Lord and your Lord, so serve Him: that is a straight path.’

37.Abdel Haleem: But factions have differed among themselves. What suffering will come to those who obscure the truth when a dreadful Day arrives

38.Abdel Haleem: How sharp of hearing, how sharp of sight they will be when they come to Us, although now they are clearly off course! Warn them [Muhammad] of the Day of Remorse when the matter will be decided

39.Abdel Haleem: for they are heedless and do not believe

40.Abdel Haleem: It is We who will inherit the earth and all who are on it: they will all be returned to Us

41.Abdel Haleem: Mention too, in the Quran, the story of Abraham. He was a man of truth, a prophet

42.Abdel Haleem: He said to his father, ‘Father, why do you worship something that can neither hear nor see nor benefit you in any way

43.Abdel Haleem: Father, knowledge that has not reached you has come to me, so follow me: I will guide you to an even path

44.Abdel Haleem: Father, do not worship Satan- Satan has rebelled against the Lord of Mercy

45.Abdel Haleem: Father, I fear that a punishment from the Lord of Mercy may afflict you and that you may become Satan’s companion [in Hell].&rsquo

46.Abdel Haleem: His father answered, ‘Abraham, do you reject my gods? I will stone you if you do not stop this. Keep out of my way!’

47.Abdel Haleem: Abraham said, ‘Peace be with you: I will beg my Lord to forgive you- He is always gracious to me

48.Abdel Haleem: but for now I will leave you, and the idols you all pray to, and I will pray to my Lord and trust that my prayer will not be in vain.’

49.Abdel Haleem: When he left his people and those they served beside God, We granted him Isaac and Jacob and made them both prophets

50.Abdel Haleem: We granted Our grace to all of them, and gave them a noble reputation

51.Abdel Haleem: Mention too, in the Quran, the story of Moses. He was specially chosen, a messenger and a prophet

52.Abdel Haleem: We called to him from the right-hand side of the mountain and brought him close to Us in secret communion

53.Abdel Haleem: out of Our grace We granted him his brother Aaron as a prophet

54.Abdel Haleem: Mention too, in the Quran, the story of Ishmael. He was true to his promise, a messenger and a prophet

55.Abdel Haleem: He commanded his household to pray and give alms, and his Lord was well pleased with him

56.Abdel Haleem: Mention too, in the Quran, the story of Idris. He was a man of truth, a prophet

57.Abdel Haleem: We raised him to a high position

58.Abdel Haleem: These were the prophets God blessed- from the seed of Adam, of those We carried in the Ark with Noah, from the seed of Abraham and Israel- and those We guided and chose. When the revelations of the Lord of Mercy were recited to them, they fell to their knees and wept

59.Abdel Haleem: but there came after them generations who neglected prayer and were driven by their own desires. These will come face to face with their evil

60.Abdel Haleem: but those who repent, who believe, who do righteous deeds, will enter Paradise. They will not be wronged in the least

61.Abdel Haleem: they will enter the Gardens of Lasting Bliss, promised by the Lord of Mercy to His servants- it is not yet seen but truly His promise will be fulfilled

62.Abdel Haleem: There they will hear only peaceful talk, nothing bad; there they will be given provision morning and evening

63.Abdel Haleem: That is the Garden We shall give as their own to those of Our servants who were devout

64.Abdel Haleem: [Gabriel said],‘We only descend [with revelation] at your Lord’s command––everything before us, everything behind us, everything in between, all belongs to Him––your Lord is never forgetful

65.Abdel Haleem: He is Lord of the heavens and earth and everything in between so worship Him: be steadfast in worshipping Him. Do you know of anyone equal to Him?’

66.Abdel Haleem: Man says, ‘What? Once I am dead, will I be brought back to life?’

67.Abdel Haleem: but does man not remember that We created him when he was nothing before

68.Abdel Haleem: By your Lord [Prophet] We shall gather them and the devils together and set them on their knees around Hell

69.Abdel Haleem: We shall seize out of each group those who were most disobedient towards the Lord of Mercy

70.Abdel Haleem: We know best who most deserves to burn in Hell

71.Abdel Haleem: but every single one of you will approach it, a decree from your Lord which must be fulfilled

72.Abdel Haleem: We shall save the devout and leave the evildoers there on their knees

73.Abdel Haleem: When Our revelations are recited to them in all their clarity, [all that] the disbelievers say to the believers [is], ‘Which side is better situated? Which side has the better following?’

74.Abdel Haleem: We have destroyed many a generation before them who surpassed them in riches and outward glitter

75.Abdel Haleem: Say [Prophet], ‘The Lord of Mercy lengthens [the lives] of the misguided, until, when they are confronted with what they have been warned about- either the punishment [in this life] or the Hour [of Judgement]- they realize who is worse situated and who has the weakest forces.’

76.Abdel Haleem: But God gives more guidance to those who are guided, and good deeds of lasting merit are best and most rewarding in your Lord’s sight

77.Abdel Haleem: Have you considered the man who rejects Our revelation, who says, ‘I will certainly be given wealth and children’

78.Abdel Haleem: Has he penetrated the unknown or received a pledge to that effect from the Lord of Mercy

79.Abdel Haleem: No! We shall certainly record what he says and prolong his punishment

80.Abdel Haleem: We shall inherit from him all that he speaks of and he will come to Us all alone

81.Abdel Haleem: They have taken other gods beside God to give them strength

82.Abdel Haleem: but these gods will reject their worship and will even turn against them

83.Abdel Haleem: Have you [Prophet] not seen how We send devils to incite the disbelievers to sin

84.Abdel Haleem: There is no need for you to be impatient concerning them: We are counting down their [allotted] time

85.Abdel Haleem: On the Day We gather the righteous as an honoured company before the Lord of Merc

86.Abdel Haleem: and drive the sinful like a thirsty herd into Hell

87.Abdel Haleem: no one will have power to intercede except for those who have permission from the Lord of Mercy

88.Abdel Haleem: The disbelievers say, ‘The Lord of Mercy has offspring.’

89.Abdel Haleem: How terrible is this thing you assert

90.Abdel Haleem: it almost causes the heavens to be torn apart, the earth to split asunder, the mountains to crumble to pieces

91.Abdel Haleem: that they attribute offspring to the Lord of Mercy

92.Abdel Haleem: It does not befit the Lord of Mercy [to have offspring]

93.Abdel Haleem: there is no one in the heavens or earth who will not come to the Lord of Mercy as a servant

94.Abdel Haleem: He has counted them all: He has numbered them exactly

95.Abdel Haleem: and they will each return to Him on the Day of Resurrection all alone

96.Abdel Haleem: But the Lord of Mercy will give love to those who believe and do righteous deeds

97.Abdel Haleem: We have made it easy, in your own language [Prophet], so that you may bring glad news to the righteous and warnings to a stubborn people

98.Abdel Haleem: How many generations We have destroyed before them! Do you perceive a single one of them now, or hear as much as a whisper

1.Abdel Haleem: Ta H

2.Abdel Haleem: It was not to distress you [Prophet] that We sent down the Quran to you

3.Abdel Haleem: but as a reminder for those who hold God in awe

4.Abdel Haleem: a revelation from the One who created the earth and the high heaven

5.Abdel Haleem: the Lord of Mercy, established on the throne

6.Abdel Haleem: Everything in the heavens and on earth, everything between them, everything beneath the soil, belongs to Him

7.Abdel Haleem: Whatever you may say aloud, He knows what you keep secret and what is even more hidden

8.Abdel Haleem: God––there is no god but Him––the most excellent names belong to Him

9.Abdel Haleem: Has the story of Moses come to you [Prophet]

10.Abdel Haleem: He saw a fire and said to his people, ‘Stay here––I can see a fire. Maybe I can bring you a flaming brand from it or find some guidance there.’

11.Abdel Haleem: When he came to the fire, he was summoned, ‘Moses

12.Abdel Haleem: I am your Lord. Take off your shoes: you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa

13.Abdel Haleem: I have chosen you, so listen to what is being revealed

14.Abdel Haleem: I am God; there is no god but Me. So worship Me and keep up the prayer so that you remember Me

15.Abdel Haleem: The Hour is coming––though I choose to keep it hidden––for each soul to be rewarded for its labour

16.Abdel Haleem: Do not let anyone who does not believe in it and follows his own desires distract you from it, and so bring you to ruin.’

17.Abdel Haleem: ‘Moses, what is that in your right hand?’

18.Abdel Haleem: ‘It is my staff,’ he said, ‘I lean on it; restrain my sheep with it; I also have other uses for it.’

19.Abdel Haleem: God said, ‘Throw it down, Moses.’

20.Abdel Haleem: He threw it down and- lo and behold!- it became a fast-moving snake

21.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘Pick it up without fear: We shall turn it back into its former state

22.Abdel Haleem: Now place your hand under your armpit and it will come out white, though unharmed: that is another sign

23.Abdel Haleem: We do this to show you some of Our greatest signs

24.Abdel Haleem: Go to Pharaoh, for he has truly become a tyrant.’

25.Abdel Haleem: Moses said, ‘Lord, lift up my hear

26.Abdel Haleem: and ease my task for me

27.Abdel Haleem: Untie my tongue

28.Abdel Haleem: so that they may understand my words

29.Abdel Haleem: and give me a helper from my family

30.Abdel Haleem: my brother Aaron

31.Abdel Haleem: augment my strength through him

32.Abdel Haleem: Let him share my tas

33.Abdel Haleem: so that we can glorify You muc

34.Abdel Haleem: and remember You often

35.Abdel Haleem: You are always watching over us.’

36.Abdel Haleem: God said, ‘Moses, your request is granted

37.Abdel Haleem: Indeed We showed you favour before

38.Abdel Haleem: We inspired your mother, saying

39.Abdel Haleem: “Put your child into the chest, then place him in the river. Let the river wash him on to its bank, and he will be taken in by an enemy of Mine and his.” I showered you with My love and planned that you should be reared under My watchful eye

40.Abdel Haleem: Your sister went out, saying, “I will tell you someone who will nurse him,” then We returned you to your mother so that she could rejoice and not grieve. Later you killed a man, but We saved you from distress and tried you with other tests. You stayed among the people of Midian for years, then you came here as I ordained

41.Abdel Haleem: I have chosen you for Myself

42.Abdel Haleem: Go, you and your brother, with My signs, and make sure that you remember Me

43.Abdel Haleem: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh, for he has exceeded all bounds

44.Abdel Haleem: Speak to him gently so that he may take heed, or show respect.’

45.Abdel Haleem: They said, ‘Lord, we fear he will do us great harm or exceed all bounds.’

46.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘Do not be afraid, I am with you both, hearing and seeing everything

47.Abdel Haleem: Go and tell him, “We are your Lord’s mes-sengers, so send the Children of Israel with us and do not oppress them. We have brought you a sign from your Lord. Peace be upon whoever follows the right guidance

48.Abdel Haleem: it has been revealed to us that punishment falls on whoever rejects the truth and turns his back on it.”&rsquo

49.Abdel Haleem: [Pharaoh] said, ‘Moses, who is this Lord of yours?’

50.Abdel Haleem: Moses said, ‘Our Lord is He who gave everything its form, then gave it guidance.’

51.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘What about former generations?’

52.Abdel Haleem: Moses said, ‘My Lord alone has knowledge of them, all in a record; my Lord does not err or forget.’

53.Abdel Haleem: It was He who spread out the earth for you and traced routes in it. He sent down water from the sky. With that water We bring forth every kind of plant

54.Abdel Haleem: so eat, and graze your cattle. There are truly signs in all this for people of understand-ing

55.Abdel Haleem: From the earth We created you, into it We shall return you, and from it We shall raise you a second time

56.Abdel Haleem: We showed Pharaoh all Our signs, but he denied them and refused [to change]

57.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘Have you come to drive us from our land with your sorcery, Moses

58.Abdel Haleem: We will confront you with sorcery to match your own: make an appointment between us which neither of us will fail to keep, in a mutually agreeable place.’

59.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘Your meeting will be on the day of the feast, so let the people be assembled when the sun has risen high.’

60.Abdel Haleem: Pharaoh withdrew and gathered his resources, then he returned

61.Abdel Haleem: Moses said to them, ‘Beware, do not invent lies against God or He will destroy you with His punishment. Whoever invents lies will fail.’

62.Abdel Haleem: So they discussed their plan among themselves, talking secretly

63.Abdel Haleem: saying, ‘These two men are sorcerers. Their purpose is to drive you out of your land with their sorcery and put an end to your time-honoured way of life

64.Abdel Haleem: So gather your resources and line up for the contest. Whoever wins today is sure to prosper.’

65.Abdel Haleem: They said, ‘Moses, will you throw first or shall we?’

66.Abdel Haleem: ‘You throw,’ said Moses, and––lo and behold!––through their sorcery, their ropes and staffs seemed to him to be moving

67.Abdel Haleem: Moses was inwardly alarmed

68.Abdel Haleem: but We said, ‘Do not be afraid, you have the upper hand

69.Abdel Haleem: Throw down what is in your right hand: it will swallow up what they have produced. They have only produced the tricks of a sorcerer, and a sorcerer will not prosper, wherever he goes.’

70.Abdel Haleem: [So it was, and] the sorcerers threw themselves down in submission. ‘We believe,’ they said, ‘in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.’

71.Abdel Haleem: Pharaoh said, ‘How dare you believe in him before I have given you permission? This must be your master, the man who taught you witchcraft. I shall certainly cut off your alternate hands and feet, then crucify you on the trunks of palm trees. You will know for certain which of us has the fiercer and more lasting punishment.’

72.Abdel Haleem: They said, ‘We shall never prefer you to the clear sign that has come to us, nor to Him who created us. So decide whatever you will: you can only decide matters of this present life

73.Abdel Haleem: we believe in our Lord, [hoping] He may forgive us our sins and the sorcery that you forced us to practise- God is better and more lasting.’

74.Abdel Haleem: Hell will be the reward of those who return to their Lord as evildoers: there they will stay, neither living nor dying

75.Abdel Haleem: But those who return to their Lord as believers with righteous deeds will be rewarded with the highest of ranks

76.Abdel Haleem: Gardens of lasting bliss graced with flowing streams, and there they will stay. Such is the reward of those who purify themselves

77.Abdel Haleem: We revealed to Moses, ‘Go out at night with My servants and strike a dry path for them across the sea. Have no fear of being overtaken and do not be dismayed.’

78.Abdel Haleem: Pharaoh pursued them with his armies and was overwhelmed by the sea

79.Abdel Haleem: Pharaoh truly led his people astray; he did not guide them

80.Abdel Haleem: Children of Israel, We rescued you from your enemies. We made a pledge with you on the right-hand side of the mountain. We sent down manna and quails for you

81.Abdel Haleem: ‘Eat from the good things We have provided for you, but do not overstep the bounds, or My wrath will descend on you. Anyone on whom My wrath descends has truly fallen

82.Abdel Haleem: Yet I am most forgiving towards those who repent, believe, do righteous deeds, and stay on the right path.’

83.Abdel Haleem: [God said], ‘Moses, what has made you come ahead of your people in such haste?’

84.Abdel Haleem: and he said, ‘They are following in my footsteps. I rushed to You, Lord, to please You,’

85.Abdel Haleem: but God said, ‘We have tested your people in your absence: the Samiri has led them astray.’

86.Abdel Haleem: Moses returned to his people, angry and aggrieved. He said, ‘My people, did your Lord not make you a gracious promise? Was my absence too long for you? Did you want anger to fall on you from your Lord and so broke your word to me?’

87.Abdel Haleem: They said, ‘We did not break our word to you deliberately. We were burdened with the weight of people’s jewellery, so we threw it [into the fire], and the Samiri did the same,’

88.Abdel Haleem: but he [used the molten jewellery to] produce an image of a calf which made a lowing sound, and they said, ‘This is your god and Moses’ god, but he has forgotten.’

89.Abdel Haleem: Did they not see that [the calf] gave them no answer, that it had no power to harm or benefit them

90.Abdel Haleem: Aaron did say to them, ‘My people, this calf is a test for you. Your true Lord is the Lord of Mercy, so follow me and obey my orders,’

91.Abdel Haleem: but they replied, ‘We shall not give up our devotion to it until Moses returns to us.’

92.Abdel Haleem: Moses said, ‘When you realized they had gone astray, what prevented you, Aaron

93.Abdel Haleem: from coming after me? How could you disobey my orders?’

94.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘Son of my mother- let go of my beard and my hair!- I was afraid you would say, “You have caused division among the children of Israel and have not heeded what I said.”&rsquo

95.Abdel Haleem: Moses said, ‘And what was the matter with you, Samiri?’

96.Abdel Haleem: He replied, ‘I saw something they did not; I took in some of the teachings of the Messenger but tossed them aside: my soul prompted me to do what I did.’

97.Abdel Haleem: Moses said, ‘Get away from here! Your lot in this life is to say, “Do not touch me,” but you have an appointment from which there is no escape. Look at your god which you have kept on worshipping- we shall grind it down and scatter it into the sea

98.Abdel Haleem: [People], your true god is the One God- there is no god but Him- whose knowledge embraces everything.’

99.Abdel Haleem: In this way We relate to you [Prophet] stories of what happened before. We have given you a Quran from Us

100.Abdel Haleem: Whoever turns away from it will bear on the Day of Resurrection a heavy burde

101.Abdel Haleem: and will remain under it. What a terrible burden to carry on that Day

102.Abdel Haleem: When the trumpet is sounded and We gather the sinful, sightless

103.Abdel Haleem: they will murmur to one another, ‘You stayed only ten days [on earth]’

104.Abdel Haleem: We know best what they say- but the more perceptive of them will say, ‘Your stay [on earth] was only a single day.’

105.Abdel Haleem: They ask you [Prophet] about the mountains: say, ‘[On that Day] my Lord will blast them into dus

107.Abdel Haleem: with no peak or trough to be seen

108.Abdel Haleem: On that Day, people will follow the summoner from whom there is no escape; every voice will be hushed for the Lord of Mercy; only whispers will be heard

109.Abdel Haleem: On that Day, intercession will be useless except from those to whom the Lord of Mercy has granted permission and whose words He approves

110.Abdel Haleem: He knows what is before and behind them, though they do not comprehend Him

111.Abdel Haleem: and [all] faces will be humbled before the Living, Ever Watchful One. Those burdened with evil deeds will despair

112.Abdel Haleem: but whoever has done righteous deeds and believed need have no fear of injustice or deprivation.’

113.Abdel Haleem: We have sent the Quran down in the Arabic tongue and given all kinds of warnings in it, so that they may beware or take heed

114.Abdel Haleem: exalted be God, the one who is truly in control. [Prophet], do not rush to recite before the revelation is fully complete but say, ‘Lord, increase me in knowledge!’

115.Abdel Haleem: We also commanded Adam before you, but he forgot and We found him lacking in constancy

116.Abdel Haleem: When We said to the angels, ‘Bow down before Adam,’ they did. But Iblis refused

117.Abdel Haleem: so We said, ‘Adam, this is your enemy, yours and your wife’s: do not let him drive you out of the garden and make you miserable

118.Abdel Haleem: In the garden you will never go hungry, feel naked

119.Abdel Haleem: be thirsty, or suffer the heat of the sun.’

120.Abdel Haleem: But Satan whispered to Adam, saying, ‘Adam, shall I show you the tree of immortality and power that never decays?’

121.Abdel Haleem: and they both ate from it. They became conscious of their nakedness and began to cover themselves with leaves from the garden. Adam disobeyed his Lord and was led astray

122.Abdel Haleem: later his Lord brought him close, accepted his repentance, and guided him

123.Abdel Haleem: God said, ‘Get out of the garden as each other’s enemy.’ Whoever follows My guidance, when it comes to you [people], will not go astray nor fall into misery

124.Abdel Haleem: but whoever turns away from it will have a life of great hardship. We shall bring him blind to the Assembly on the Day of Resurrectio

125.Abdel Haleem: and he will say, ‘Lord, why did You bring me here blind? I was sighted before!’

126.Abdel Haleem: God will say, ‘This is how it is: You ignored Our revelations when they came to you, so today you will be ignored.’

127.Abdel Haleem: This is how We reward those who go too far, and who do not believe in their Lord’s revelations. The greatest and most enduring punishment is in the Hereafter

128.Abdel Haleem: Do they not draw a lesson from the many generations We destroyed before them, through whose dwelling places they now walk? There truly are signs in this for anyone with understanding

129.Abdel Haleem: If it were not for a preordained Word from your Lord [Prophet], they would already have been destroyed. Their time has been set

130.Abdel Haleem: so [Prophet] be patient with what they say- celebrate the praise of your Lord, before the rising and setting of the sun, celebrate His praise during the night, and at the beginning and end of the day, so that you may find contentment

131.Abdel Haleem: and do not gaze longingly at what We have given some of them to enjoy, the finery of this present life: We test them through this, but the provision of your Lord is better and more lasting

132.Abdel Haleem: Order your people to pray, and pray steadfastly yourself. We are not asking you to give Us provision;We provide for you, and the rewards of the Hereafter belong to the devout

133.Abdel Haleem: The disbelievers say, ‘Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?’ Have they not been given clear proof confirming what was in the earlier scriptures

134.Abdel Haleem: If We had destroyed them through punishment before this Messenger came, they would have said, ‘Lord, if only You had sent us a messenger, we could have followed Your revelations before we suffered humiliation and disgrace!’

135.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], say, ‘We are all waiting, so you carry on waiting: you will come to learn who has followed the even path, and been rightly guided.’

1.Abdel Haleem: Ever closer to people draws their reckoning, while they turn away, heedless

2.Abdel Haleem: Whenever any fresh revelation comes to them from their Lord, they listen to it playfull

3.Abdel Haleem: with frivolous hearts. The evildoers conferred in secret: ‘Is this man anything but a mortal like yourselves? Are you going to fall under his spell with your eyes wide open?’

4.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘My Lord knows everything that is said in the heavens and the earth: He is the All Hearing, the All Knowing.’

5.Abdel Haleem: Some say, ‘Muddled dreams’; others, ‘He made it up’; yet others, ‘He is just a poet, let him show us a sign as previous messengers did.’

6.Abdel Haleem: But of the communities We destroyed before them not a single one believed. Will these now believe

7.Abdel Haleem: And even before your time [Prophet], all the messengers We sent were only men We inspired–– if you [disbelievers] do not know, ask people who know the Scripture–&ndash

8.Abdel Haleem: We did not give them bodies that ate no food, nor were they immortal

9.Abdel Haleem: We fulfilled Our promise to them in the end: We saved them and those We wished to save, and We destroyed those who exceeded all bounds

10.Abdel Haleem: And now We have sent down to you [people] a Scripture to remind you. Will you not use your reason

11.Abdel Haleem: How many communities of evildoers We have destroyed! How many others We have raised up in their places

12.Abdel Haleem: When they felt Our might coming upon them, see how they tried to escape it

13.Abdel Haleem: ‘Do not try to escape. Go back to your homes and the pleasure you revelled in: you may be questioned.’

14.Abdel Haleem: They said, ‘Woe to us! We were wrong!’

15.Abdel Haleem: and that cry of theirs did not cease until We made them burnt-offstubble

16.Abdel Haleem: We did not create the heavens and the earth and everything between them playfully

17.Abdel Haleem: If We had wished for a pastime, We could have found it within Us- if We had wished for any such thing

18.Abdel Haleem: No! We hurl the truth against falsehood, and truth obliterates it- see how falsehood vanishes away! Woe to you [people] for the way you describe God

19.Abdel Haleem: Everyone in the heavens and earth belongs to Him, and those that are with Him are never too proud to worship Him, nor do they grow weary

20.Abdel Haleem: they glorify Him tirelessly night and day

21.Abdel Haleem: Have they chosen any gods from the earth who can give life to the dead

22.Abdel Haleem: If there had been in the heavens or earth any gods but Him, both heavens and earth would be in ruins: God, Lord of the Throne, is far above the things they say

23.Abdel Haleem: He cannot be called to account for anything He does, whereas they will be called to account

24.Abdel Haleem: Have they chosen to worship other gods instead of Him? Say, ‘Bring your proof. This is the Scripture for those who are with me and the Scripture for those who went before me.’ But most of them do not recognize the truth, so they pay no heed

25.Abdel Haleem: We never sent any messenger before you [Muhammad] without revealing to him: ‘There is no god but Me, so serve Me.’

26.Abdel Haleem: And they say, ‘The Lord of Mercy has taken offspring for Himself.’ May He be exalted! No! They are only His honoured servants

27.Abdel Haleem: they do not speak before He speaks and they act by His command

28.Abdel Haleem: He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and they cannot intercede without His permission––indeed they themselves stand in awe of Him

29.Abdel Haleem: If any of them were to claim, ‘I am a god beside Him,’ We would reward them with Hell: this is how We reward evildoers

30.Abdel Haleem: Are the disbelievers not aware that the heavens and the earth used to be joined together and that We ripped them apart, that We made every living thing from water? Will they not believe

31.Abdel Haleem: And We put firm mountains on the earth, lest it should sway under them, and set broad paths on it, so that they might follow the right direction

32.Abdel Haleem: and We made the sky a well-secured canopy- yet from its wonders they turn away

33.Abdel Haleem: It is He who created night and day, the sun and the moon, each floating in its orbit

34.Abdel Haleem: We have not granted everlasting life to any other human being before you either [Muhammad]- if you die, will [the disbelievers] live for ever

35.Abdel Haleem: Every soul is certain to taste death: We test you all through the bad and the good, and to Us you will all return

36.Abdel Haleem: When the disbelievers see you, they laugh at you: ‘Is this the one who talks about your gods?’ They reject any talk of the Lord of Mercy

37.Abdel Haleem: Man was created hasty: I will show you My signs soon, so do not ask Me to hasten them

38.Abdel Haleem: They say, ‘When will this promise be fulfilled, if what you say is true?’

39.Abdel Haleem: If the disbelievers only knew, the time will arrive when they will not be able to ward off the Fire from their faces or their backs, and they will get no help

40.Abdel Haleem: It will come upon them suddenly and stupefy them; they will be powerless to push it away; they will not be reprieved

41.Abdel Haleem: Messengers before you [Muhammad] were also ridiculed, but those who mocked them were overwhelmed in the end by the very thing they had mocked

42.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘Who could protect you night and day from the Lord of Mercy?’ Yet they turn away when their Lord is mentioned

43.Abdel Haleem: Do they have gods who can defend them against Us? Their gods have no power to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us

44.Abdel Haleem: We have allowed these sinners and their forefathers to enjoy life for a long time. But do they not see how We are shrinking their borders? Is it they who will prevail

45.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘I warn you only through the Revelation.’ The deaf will not hear the warning call

46.Abdel Haleem: yet if a mere breath of your Lord’s punishment touches them, they will be sure to cry, ‘Woe to us! We were wrong!’

47.Abdel Haleem: We will set up scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection so that no one can be wronged in the least, and if there should be even the weight of a mustard seed, We shall bring it out- We take excellent account

48.Abdel Haleem: We gave Moses and Aaron [the Scripture] that distinguishes right from wrong, a light and a reminder for those who are mindful of God

49.Abdel Haleem: those who stand in awe of their Lord, though He is unseen, and who fear the Hour

50.Abdel Haleem: This [Quran] too is a blessed message We have sent down- are you [people] going to deny it

51.Abdel Haleem: Long ago We bestowed right judgement on Abraham and We knew him well

52.Abdel Haleem: He said to his father and his people, ‘What are these images to which you are so devoted?’

53.Abdel Haleem: They replied, ‘We found our fathers worshipping them.’

54.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘You and your fathers have clearly gone astray.’

55.Abdel Haleem: They asked, ‘Have you brought us the truth or are you just playing about?’

56.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘Listen! Your true Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, He who created them, and I am a witness to this

57.Abdel Haleem: By God I shall certainly plot against your idols as soon as you have turned your backs!’

58.Abdel Haleem: He broke them all into pieces, but left the biggest one for them to return to

59.Abdel Haleem: They said, ‘Who has done this to our gods? How wicked he must be!’

60.Abdel Haleem: Some said, ‘We heard a youth called Abraham talking about them.’

61.Abdel Haleem: They said, ‘Bring him before the eyes of the people, so that they may witness [his trial].&rsquo

62.Abdel Haleem: They asked, ‘Was it you, Abraham, who did this to our gods?’

63.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘No, it was done by the biggest of them- this one. Ask them, if they can talk.’

64.Abdel Haleem: They turned to one another, saying, ‘It is you who are in the wrong,’

65.Abdel Haleem: but then they lapsed again and said, ‘You know very well these gods cannot speak.’

66.Abdel Haleem: Abraham said, ‘How can you worship what can neither benefit nor harm you, instead of God

67.Abdel Haleem: Shame on you and on the things you worship instead of God. Have you no sense?’

68.Abdel Haleem: They said, ‘Burn him and avenge your gods, if you are going to do the right thing.’

69.Abdel Haleem: But We said, ‘Fire, be cool and safe for Abraham.’

70.Abdel Haleem: They planned to harm him, but We made them suffer the greatest loss

71.Abdel Haleem: We saved him and Lot [and sent them] to the land We blessed for all people

72.Abdel Haleem: and We gave him Isaac and Jacob as an additional gift, and made each of them righteous

73.Abdel Haleem: We made all of them leaders, guiding others by Our command, and We inspired them to do good works, to keep up the prayer, and to give alms: they were Our true worshippers

74.Abdel Haleem: We gave Lot sound judgement and knowledge and saved him from the community who practised obscenities- they were shameless people who broke God’s law

75.Abdel Haleem: We admitted him to Our mercy; he was a righteous man

76.Abdel Haleem: Long before that, We answered Noah when he cried out to Us: We saved him and his family from the great calamit

77.Abdel Haleem: and We helped him against the people who rejected Our signs- they were evil people, so We drowned them all

78.Abdel Haleem: And remember David and Solomon, when they gave judgement regarding the field into which sheep strayed by night and grazed. We witnessed their judgemen

79.Abdel Haleem: and made Solomon understand the case [better], though We gave sound judgement and knowledge to both of them. We made the mountains and the birds celebrate Our praises with David- We did all these things

80.Abdel Haleem: We taught him how to make coats of mail for the benefit of you [people], to protect you in your wars, but are you grateful for this

81.Abdel Haleem: We harnessed the stormy wind for Solomon, so that it sped by his command to the land We had blessed- We have knowledge of all things

82.Abdel Haleem: and We made some of the jinn subservient to him, to dive for him and do other works besides. We were watching over them

83.Abdel Haleem: Remember Job, when he cried to his Lord, ‘Suffering has truly afflicted me, but you are the Most Merciful of the merciful.’

84.Abdel Haleem: We answered him, removed his suffering, and restored his family to him, along with more like them, as an act of grace from Us and a reminder for all who serve Us

85.Abdel Haleem: And remember Ishmael, Idris, and Dhu’l-Kifl: they were all steadfast

86.Abdel Haleem: We admitted them to Our mercy; they were truly righteous

87.Abdel Haleem: And remember the man with the whale,when he went off angrily, thinking We could not restrict him, but then he cried out in the deep darkness, ‘There is no God but You, glory be to You, I was wrong.’

88.Abdel Haleem: We answered him and saved him from distress: this is how We save the faithful

89.Abdel Haleem: Remember Zachariah, when he cried to his Lord, ‘My Lord, do not leave me childless, though You are the best of heirs.’

90.Abdel Haleem: We answered him––We gave him John, and cured his wife of barrenness- they were always keen to do good deeds. They called upon Us out of longing and awe, and humbled themselves before Us

91.Abdel Haleem: Remember the one who guarded her chastity. We breathed into her from Our Spirit and made her and her son a sign for all people

92.Abdel Haleem: [Messengers], this community of yours is one single community and I am your Lord, so serve Me

93.Abdel Haleem: They have torn their unity apart, but they will all return to Us

94.Abdel Haleem: If anyone does good deeds and is a believer, his efforts will not be ignored: We record them for him

95.Abdel Haleem: No community destroyed by Us can escape its return

96.Abdel Haleem: and when the peoples of Gog and Magog are let loose and swarm swiftly from every highland

97.Abdel Haleem: when the True Promise draws near, the disbelievers’ eyes will stare in terror, and they will say, ‘Woe to us! We were not aware of this at all. We were wrong.’

98.Abdel Haleem: You [disbelievers] and what you worship instead of God will be fuel for Hell: that is where you will go

99.Abdel Haleem: if these [idols] had been real gods they would not have gone there- you will all stay there

100.Abdel Haleem: There the disbelievers will be groaning piteously, but the [idols] will hear nothing

101.Abdel Haleem: But those for whom We have decreed Paradise will be kept far from Hell

102.Abdel Haleem: they will not hear a murmur from it- and endlessly they will enjoy everything their souls desire

103.Abdel Haleem: They will have no fear of the great Terror: the angels will receive them with the words, ‘This is the Day you were promised!’

104.Abdel Haleem: On that Day, We shall roll up the skies as a writer rolls up [his] scrolls. We shall reproduce creation just as We produced it the first time: this is Our binding promise. We shall certainly do all these things

105.Abdel Haleem: We wrote in the Psalms, as We did in [earlier] Scripture: ‘My righteous servants will inherit the earth.’

106.Abdel Haleem: There truly is a message in this for the servants of God

107.Abdel Haleem: It was only as a mercy that We sent you [Prophet] to all people

108.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘What is revealed to me is that your God is one God- will you submit to Him?’

109.Abdel Haleem: But if they turn away, say, ‘I have proclaimed the message fairly to you all. I do not know whether the judgement you are promised is near or far

110.Abdel Haleem: but He knows what you reveal and conceal

111.Abdel Haleem: I do not know: this [time] may well be a test for you, and enjoyment for a while.’

112.Abdel Haleem: He said,‘My Lord, pass the true judgement.’ And, ‘Our Lord is the Lord of Mercy. We seek His assistance against what you [disbelievers] say.’

1.Abdel Haleem: People, be mindful of your Lord, for the earthquake of the Last Hour will be a mighty thing

2.Abdel Haleem: on the Day you see it, every nursing mother will think no more of her baby, every pregnant female will miscarry, you will think people are drunk when they are not, so severe will be God’s torment

3.Abdel Haleem: Yet still there are some who, with no knowledge, argue about God, who follow every devilish rebe

4.Abdel Haleem: fated to lead astray those who take his side, and guide them to the suffering of the blazing flame

5.Abdel Haleem: People, [remember,] if you doubt the Resurrection, that We created you from dust, then a drop of fluid, then a clinging form, then a lump of flesh, both shaped and unshaped: We mean to make Our power clear to you. Whatever We choose We cause to remain in the womb for an appointed time, then We bring you forth as infants and then you grow and reach maturity. Some die young and some are left to live on to such an age that they forget all they once knew. You sometimes see the earth lifeless, yet when We send down water it stirs and swells and produces every kind of joyous growth

6.Abdel Haleem: this is because God is the Truth; He brings the dead back to life; He has power over everything

7.Abdel Haleem: There is no doubt that the Last Hour is bound to come, nor that God will raise the dead from their graves

8.Abdel Haleem: yet still there are some who, with no knowledge or guidance or any book of enlightenment, argue about God

9.Abdel Haleem: turning scornfully aside to lead others away from God’s path. Disgrace in this world awaits such a person and, on the Day of Resurrection, We shall make him taste the suffering of the Fire

10.Abdel Haleem: [It will be said], ‘This is for what you have stored up with your own hands: God is never unjust to His creatures.’

11.Abdel Haleem: There are also some who serve God with unsteady faith: if something good comes their way, they are satisfied, but if they are tested, they revert to their old ways, losing both this world and the next- that is the clearest loss

12.Abdel Haleem: Instead of God, they call upon what can neither harm nor help them- that is straying far away

13.Abdel Haleem: or invoke one whose harm is closer than his help: an evil master and an evil companion

14.Abdel Haleem: But God will admit those who believe and do good deeds to Gardens graced with flowing streams. God does whatever He wishes

15.Abdel Haleem: Anyone who thinks that God will not support him in this world and the next should stretch a rope up to the sky, climb all the way up it, and see whether this strategy removes the cause of his anger

16.Abdel Haleem: In this way, We send the Quran down as clear messages, and God guides whoever He will

17.Abdel Haleem: As for the believers, those who follow the Jewish faith, the Sabians, the Christians, the Magians, and the idolaters, God will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection; God witnesses all things

18.Abdel Haleem: Do you not realize [Prophet] that everything in the heavens and earth submits to God: the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, and the animals? So do many human beings, though for many others punishment is well deserved. Anyone disgraced by God will have no one to honour him: God does whatever He will

19.Abdel Haleem: These two kinds of people disagree about their Lord. Garments of fire will be tailored for those who disbelieve; scalding water will be poured over their heads

20.Abdel Haleem: melting their insides as well as their skins

21.Abdel Haleem: there will be iron crooks to restrain them

22.Abdel Haleem: whenever, in their anguish, they try to escape, they will be pushed back in and told, ‘Taste the suffering of the Fire.’

23.Abdel Haleem: But God will admit those who believe and do good deeds to Gardens graced with flowing streams; there they will be adorned with golden bracelets and pearls; there they will have silken garments

24.Abdel Haleem: They were guided to good speech and to the path of the One Worthy of all Praise

25.Abdel Haleem: As for the disbelievers, who bar others from God’s path and from the Sacred Mosque- which We made for all people, residents and visitors alike- and who try to violate it with wrongdoing, We shall make them taste a painful punishment

26.Abdel Haleem: We showed Abraham the site of the House, saying, ‘Do not assign partners to Me. Purify My House for those who circle around it, those who stand to pray, and those who bow and prostrate themselves

27.Abdel Haleem: Proclaim the Pilgrimage to all people. They will come to you on foot and on every kind of swift mount, emerging from every deep mountain pas

28.Abdel Haleem: to attain benefits and celebrate God’s name, on specified days, over the livestock He has provided for them- feed yourselves and the poor and unfortunate

29.Abdel Haleem: so let the pilgrims perform their acts of cleansing, fulfil their vows, and circle around the Ancient House.’

30.Abdel Haleem: All this [is ordained by God]: anyone who honours the sacred ordinances of God will have good rewards from his Lord. Livestock have been made lawful to you, except for what has been explicitly forbidden. Shun the filth of idolatrous beliefs and practices and shun false utterances

31.Abdel Haleem: Devote yourselves to God and assign Him no partners, for the person who does so is like someone who has been hurled down from the skies and snatched up by the birds or flung to a distant place by the wind

32.Abdel Haleem: All this [is ordained by God]: those who honour God’s rites show the piety of their hearts

33.Abdel Haleem: Live-stock are useful to you until the set time. Then their place of sacrifice is near the Ancient House

34.Abdel Haleem: We appointed acts of devotion for every community, for them to celebrate God’s name over the livestock He provided for them: your God is One, so devote yourselves to Him. [Prophet], give good news to the humbl
