35.Abdel Haleem: whose hearts fill with awe whenever God is mentioned, who endure whatever happens to them with patience, who keep up the prayer, who give to others out of Our provision to them

36.Abdel Haleem: We have made camels part of God’s sacred rites for you. There is much good in them for you, so invoke God’s name over them as they are lined up for sacrifice, then, when they have fallen down dead, feed yourselves and those who do not ask, as well as those who do. We have subjected them to you in this way so that you may be thankful

37.Abdel Haleem: It is neither their meat nor their blood that reaches God but your piety. He has subjected them to you in this way so that you may glorify God for having guided you. Give good news to those who do good

38.Abdel Haleem: God will defend the believers; God does not love the unfaithful or the ungrateful

39.Abdel Haleem: Those who have been attacked are permitted to take up arms because they have been wronged- God has the power to help them

40.Abdel Haleem: those who have been driven unjustly from their homes only for saying, ‘Our Lord is God.’ If God did not repel some people by means of others, many monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques, where God’s name is much invoked, would have been destroyed. God is sure to help those who help His cause- God is strong and mighty

41.Abdel Haleem: those who, when We establish them in the land, keep up the prayer, pay the prescribed alms, command what is right, and forbid what is wrong: God controls the outcome of all events

42.Abdel Haleem: If they reject you [Prophet], so did the people of Noah before them, and those of Ad, Thamud

43.Abdel Haleem: Abraham, Lot

44.Abdel Haleem: Midian. Moses too was called a liar. I gave the disbelievers time, but in the end I punished them. How I condemned them

45.Abdel Haleem: How many towns steeped in wrongdoing We have destroyed and left in total ruin; how many deserted wells; how many lofty palaces

46.Abdel Haleem: Have these people [of Mecca] not travelled through the land with hearts to understand and ears to hear? It is not people’s eyes that are blind, but their hearts within their breasts

47.Abdel Haleem: They will challenge you [Prophet] to hasten the punishment. God will not fail in His promise- a Day with your Lord is like a thousand years by your reckoning

48.Abdel Haleem: To many a town steeped in wrongdoing I gave more time and then struck them down: they all return to Me in the end

49.Abdel Haleem: Say [Prophet], ‘People, I am sent only to give you clear warning.’

50.Abdel Haleem: Those who believe and do good deeds will be forgiven and have a generous reward

51.Abdel Haleem: but those who strive to oppose Our messages and try in vain to defeat Us are destined for the Blaze

52.Abdel Haleem: We have never sent any messenger or prophet before you [Muhammad] into whose wishes Satan did not insinuate something, but God removes what Satan insinuates and then God affirms His message. God is all knowing and wise

53.Abdel Haleem: He makes Satan’s insinuations a temptation only for the sick at heart and those whose hearts are hardened- the evildoers are profoundly opposed [to the Truth]

54.Abdel Haleem: and He causes those given knowledge to realize that this Revelation is your Lord’s Truth, so that they may believe in it and humble their hearts to Him: God guides the faithful to the straight path

55.Abdel Haleem: The disbelievers will remain in doubt about it until the Hour suddenly overpowers them or until torment descends on them on a Day devoid of all hope

56.Abdel Haleem: On that Day control will belong to God: He will judge between them. Those who believe and do good deeds will be admitted to Gardens of Delight

57.Abdel Haleem: while those who disbelieve and reject Our revelations will receive a humiliating torment

58.Abdel Haleem: He will give a generous provision to those who migrated in God’s way and were killed or died. He is the Best Provider

59.Abdel Haleem: He will admit them to a place that will please them: God is all knowing and most forbearing

60.Abdel Haleem: So it will be. God will help those who retaliate against an aggressive act merely with its like and are then wronged again: God is pardoning and most forgiving

61.Abdel Haleem: So it will be, because God makes night pass into day, and day into night, and He is all hearing and all seeing

62.Abdel Haleem: So it will be, because it is God alone who is the Truth, and whatever else they invoke is sheer falsehood: it is God who is the Most High, the Most Great

63.Abdel Haleem: Have you [Prophet] not considered how God sends water down from the sky and the next morning the earth becomes green? God is truly most subtle, all aware

64.Abdel Haleem: everything in the heavens and earth belongs to Him; God alone is self-sufficient, worthy of all praise

65.Abdel Haleem: Have you not considered how God has made everything on the earth of service to you? That ships sail the sea at His command? That He keeps the heavens from falling down on the earth without His permission? God is most compassionate and most merciful to mankind

66.Abdel Haleem: it is He who gave you [people] life, will cause you to die, then will give you life again- but man is ungrateful

67.Abdel Haleem: We have appointed acts of devotion for every community to observe, so do not let them argue with you [Prophet] about this matter. Call them to your Lord- you are on the right path

68.Abdel Haleem: and if they argue with you, say, ‘God is well aware of what you are doing.’

69.Abdel Haleem: On the Day of Resurrection, God will judge between you regarding your differences

70.Abdel Haleem: Are you [Prophet] not aware that God knows all that is in the heavens and earth? All this is written in a Record; this is easy for God

71.Abdel Haleem: Yet beside God they serve that for which He has sent no authority and of which they have no knowledge: the evildoers will have no one to help them

72.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], you can see the hostility on the faces of the disbelievers when Our messages are recited clearly to them: it is almost as if they are going to attack those who recite Our messages to them. Say, ‘Shall I tell you what is far worse than what you feel now? The Fire that God has promised the disbelievers! What a dismal end!’

73.Abdel Haleem: People, here is an illustration, so listen carefully: those you call on beside God could not, even if they combined all their forces, create a fly, and if a fly took something away from them, they would not be able to retrieve it. How feeble are the petitioners and how feeble are those they petition

74.Abdel Haleem: They have no grasp of God’s true measure: God is truly most strong and mighty

75.Abdel Haleem: God chooses messengers from among the angels and from among men. God is all hearing, all seeing

76.Abdel Haleem: He knows what lies before and behind them. All matters return to Him

77.Abdel Haleem: Believers, bow down, prostrate yourselves, worship your Lord, and do good so that you may succeed

78.Abdel Haleem: Strive hard for God as is His due: He has chosen you and placed no hardship in your religion, the faith of your forefather Abraham. God has called you Muslims––both in the past and in this [message]––so that the Messenger can bear witness about you and so that you can bear witness about other people. So keep up the prayer, give the prescribed alms, and seek refuge in God: He is your protector––an excellent protector and an excellent helper

1.Abdel Haleem: [How] prosperous are the believers

2.Abdel Haleem: Those who pray humbly

3.Abdel Haleem: who shun idle talk

4.Abdel Haleem: who pay the prescribed alms

5.Abdel Haleem: who guard their chastit

6.Abdel Haleem: except with their spouses or their slaves––with these they are not to blame

7.Abdel Haleem: but anyone who seeks more than this is exceeding the limits–&ndash

8.Abdel Haleem: who are faithful to their trusts and pledge

9.Abdel Haleem: and who keep up their prayers

10.Abdel Haleem: will rightly be give

11.Abdel Haleem: Paradise as their own, there to remain

12.Abdel Haleem: We created man from an essence of clay

13.Abdel Haleem: then We placed him as a drop of fluid in a safe place

14.Abdel Haleem: then We made that drop into a clinging form, and We made that form into a lump of flesh, and We made that lump into bones, and We clothed those bones with flesh, and later We made him into other forms––glory be to God, the best of creators!–&ndash

15.Abdel Haleem: then you will di

16.Abdel Haleem: and then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will be raised up again

17.Abdel Haleem: We created seven levels above you: We are never unmindful of Our creation

18.Abdel Haleem: We sent water down from the sky in due measure and lodged it in the earth––We have the power to take it all away if We so wish–&ndash

19.Abdel Haleem: with it We produced for you gardens of date palms and vines, with many fruits there for you to eat

20.Abdel Haleem: and a tree, growing out of Mount Sinai, that produces oil and seasoning for your food

21.Abdel Haleem: There is a lesson for you in livestock: We produce milk for you to drink from their bellies. And they have many other benefits: you eat the

22.Abdel Haleem: and you ride on them, as you do in ships

23.Abdel Haleem: We sent Noah to his people. He said, ‘My people, serve God, for He is your only god. Will you not heed Him?’

24.Abdel Haleem: But the leading disbelievers among his people said, ‘He is merely a mortal like you, trying to gain some superiority over you. God would have sent down angels if He had wished; besides, we never heard of anything like this from our forefathers

25.Abdel Haleem: He is just a madman, so let’s wait and see what happens to him.’

26.Abdel Haleem: Noah said, ‘My Lord, help me! They call me a liar,’

27.Abdel Haleem: and so We revealed to him: ‘Build the Ark under Our watchful eye and according to Our revelation. When Our command comes and water gushes up out of the earth,take pairs of every species on board, and your family, except for those on whom the sentence has already been passed- do not plead with me for the evildoers: they will be drowned

28.Abdel Haleem: and when you and your companions are settled on the Ark, say, “Praise be to God, who delivered us from the wicked people,”

29.Abdel Haleem: and say, “My Lord, let me land with Your blessing: it is You who provide the best landings”.&rsquo

30.Abdel Haleem: There are signs in all this: We have always put [people] to the test

31.Abdel Haleem: Then We raised another generation after them

32.Abdel Haleem: and sent one of their own as a messenger: ‘Serve God, for He is your only god. Will you not heed Him?’

33.Abdel Haleem: But the leading disbelievers among his people, who denied the Meeting in the Hereafter, to whom We had granted ease and plenty in this life, said, ‘He is just a mortal like you- he eats what you eat and drinks what you drink

34.Abdel Haleem: and you will really be losers if you obey a mortal like yourselves

35.Abdel Haleem: How can he promise you that after you die and become dust and bones you will be brought out alive

36.Abdel Haleem: What you are promised is very farfetched

37.Abdel Haleem: There is only the life of this world: we die, we live, but we will never be resurrected

38.Abdel Haleem: He is just a man making lies up about God. We will never believe in him.’

39.Abdel Haleem: The prophet said, ‘My Lord, help me! They call me a liar,’

40.Abdel Haleem: and so God said, ‘Soon they will be filled with regret.’

41.Abdel Haleem: The blast justly struck them and We swept them away like scum. Away with the evildoers

42.Abdel Haleem: We raised other generations after them

43.Abdel Haleem: no community can advance or delay its time

44.Abdel Haleem: and We sent Our messengers in succession: whenever a messenger came to a community they invariably called him a liar, so We destroyed them one after the other and made them into cautionary tales. Away with the disbelievers

45.Abdel Haleem: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron, with Our signs and clear authority

46.Abdel Haleem: to Pharaoh and his prominent leaders, but they responded with arrogance: they were a haughty people

47.Abdel Haleem: They said, ‘Are we to believe in two mortals like us? And their people are our servants?’

48.Abdel Haleem: and so they called them both liars: they became another ruined people

49.Abdel Haleem: We gave Moses the Scripture, so that they might be rightly guided

50.Abdel Haleem: We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign; We gave them shelter on a peaceful hillside with flowing water

51.Abdel Haleem: Messengers, eat good things and do good deeds: I am well aware of what you do

52.Abdel Haleem: This community of yours is one- and I am your Lord: be mindful of Me

53.Abdel Haleem: but they have split their community into sects, each rejoicing in their own

54.Abdel Haleem: So [Muhammad] leave them for a while steeped [in their ignorance]

55.Abdel Haleem: Do they reckon that, by giving them wealth and sons

56.Abdel Haleem: We race to give them good things? They really have no idea

57.Abdel Haleem: Those who stand in awe of their Lord

58.Abdel Haleem: who believe in His messages

59.Abdel Haleem: who do not ascribe partners to Him

60.Abdel Haleem: who always give with hearts that tremble at the thought that they must return to Him

61.Abdel Haleem: are the ones who race toward good things, and they will be the first to get them

62.Abdel Haleem: We do not burden any soul with more than it can bear- We have a Record that tells the truth- they will not be wronged

63.Abdel Haleem: But the disbelievers’ hearts are steeped [in ignorance of ] all this; and there are other things besides this that they do

64.Abdel Haleem: When We bring Our punishment on those corrupted with wealth, they will cry for help

65.Abdel Haleem: ‘Do not cry out today: you will get no help from Us

66.Abdel Haleem: Time and time again My messages were recited to you, but you turned arrogantly on your heels

67.Abdel Haleem: and spent the evening making fun of [the Quran].&rsquo

68.Abdel Haleem: Have they not contemplated the Word of God? Has something come to them that did not come to their forefathers

69.Abdel Haleem: Do they not recognize their Messenger? So why do they reject him

70.Abdel Haleem: Why do they say he is possessed? He has brought them the truth and most of them hate it

71.Abdel Haleem: but if the truth were in accordance with their desires, the heavens, the earth, and everyone in them would disintegrate. We have brought them their Reminder and they turn away from it

72.Abdel Haleem: Do you [Prophet] ask them for any payment? Your Lord’s is the best payment: He is the Best of Providers

73.Abdel Haleem: You call them to a straight pat

74.Abdel Haleem: and those who do not believe in the Hereafter turn away from that path

75.Abdel Haleem: Even if We were to show them mercy and relieve them of distress, they would blindly persist in their transgression

76.Abdel Haleem: We have already afflicted them, yet they did not submit to their Lord: they will not humble themselve

77.Abdel Haleem: until We open a gate to severe torment for them- then they will be plunged into utter despair

78.Abdel Haleem: It is God who endowed you with hearing, sight, and hearts- how seldom you are grateful

79.Abdel Haleem: It is He who made you multiply on earth. It is to Him that you will be gathered

80.Abdel Haleem: it is He who gives life and death; the alternation of night and day depends on Him; will you not use your minds

81.Abdel Haleem: But, like others before them

82.Abdel Haleem: they say, ‘What? When we die and turn to dust and bones, shall we really be resurrected

83.Abdel Haleem: We have heard such promises before, and so did our forefathers. These are just ancient fables.’

84.Abdel Haleem: Say [Prophet], ‘Who owns the earth and all who live in it, if you know [so much]?&rsquo

85.Abdel Haleem: and they will reply, ‘God.’ Say, ‘Will you not take heed?’

86.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘Who is the Lord of the seven heavens? Who is the Lord of the Mighty Throne?’

87.Abdel Haleem: and they will reply, ‘God.’ Say, ‘Will you not be mindful?’

88.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘Who holds control of everything in His hand? Who protects, while there is no protection against Him, if you know [so much]?&rsquo

89.Abdel Haleem: and they will reply, ‘God.’ Say, ‘Then how can you be so deluded?’

90.Abdel Haleem: The fact is, We brought them the truth and they are lying

91.Abdel Haleem: God has never had a child. Nor is there any god beside Him- if there were, each god would have taken his creation aside and tried to overcome the others. May God be exalted above what they describe

92.Abdel Haleem: He knows what is not seen as well as what is seen; He is far above any partner they claim for Him

93.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘Lord, if You are going to show me the punishment You have promised them

94.Abdel Haleem: then Lord, do not include me among the evildoers!’

95.Abdel Haleem: We certainly are able to show you the punishment We have promised them

96.Abdel Haleem: Repel evil with good- We are well aware of what they attribute to Us

97.Abdel Haleem: and say, ‘Lord, I take refuge with You from the goadings of the evil ones

98.Abdel Haleem: I seek refuge with you, Lord, so that they may not come near me.’

99.Abdel Haleem: When death comes to one of them, he cries, ‘My Lord, let me retur

100.Abdel Haleem: so as to make amends for the things I neglected.’ Never! This will not go beyond his words: a barrier stands behind such people until the very Day they are resurrected

101.Abdel Haleem: On that Day when the Trumpet is blown, the ties between them will be as nothing and they will not ask about each other

102.Abdel Haleem: those whose good deeds weigh heavy will be successful

103.Abdel Haleem: but those whose balance is light will have lost their souls for ever and will stay in Hell

104.Abdel Haleem: the Fire will scorch their faces and their lips will be twisted in pain

105.Abdel Haleem: ‘Were My messages not recited over and over to you and still you rejected them?’

106.Abdel Haleem: They will say, ‘Lord, our waywardness overcame us and we went astray

107.Abdel Haleem: Lord, take us away from this and if we go back to our old ways, then we shall really be evildoers.’

108.Abdel Haleem: He will say, ‘Away with you! In you go! Do not speak to Me

109.Abdel Haleem: Among My servants there were those who said, “Lord, We believe. Forgive us and have mercy on us: You are the most merciful of all.”

110.Abdel Haleem: But you kept on laughing at them: so intent were you on laughing at them that it made you forget My warning

111.Abdel Haleem: Today I have rewarded them for their patience: it is they who will succeed.’

112.Abdel Haleem: He will say, ‘How many years were you on earth?’

113.Abdel Haleem: and they will reply, ‘We stayed a day or a part of a day, but ask those who keep count.’

114.Abdel Haleem: He will say, ‘You stayed but a little, if you had only known

115.Abdel Haleem: Did you think We had created you in vain, and that you would not be brought back to Us?’

116.Abdel Haleem: Exalted be God, the true King, there is no god but Him, the Lord of the Glorious Throne

117.Abdel Haleem: Whoever prays to another god alongside Him- a god for whose existence he has no evidence- will face his reckoning with his Lord. Those who reject the truth will not prosper

118.Abdel Haleem: Say [Prophet], ‘Lord, forgive and have mercy: You are the most merciful of all.’

1.Abdel Haleem: This is a sura We have sent down and made obligatory: We have sent down clear revelations in it, so that you may take heed

2.Abdel Haleem: Strike the adulteress and the adulterer one hundred times. Do not let compassion for them keep you from carrying out God’s law––if you believe in God and the Last Day––and ensure that a group of believers witnesses the punishment

3.Abdel Haleem: The adulterer is only [fit] to marry an adulteress or an idolatress, and the adulteress is only [fit] to marry an adulterer or an idolater: such behaviour is forbidden to believers

4.Abdel Haleem: As for those who accuse chaste women of fornication, and then fail to provide four witnesses, strike them eighty times, and reject their testimony ever afterwards: they are the lawbreakers

5.Abdel Haleem: except for those who repent later and make amends––God is most forgiving and merciful

6.Abdel Haleem: As for those who accuse their own wives of adultery, but have no other witnesses, let each one four times call God to witness that he is telling the truth

7.Abdel Haleem: and, the fifth time, call God to reject him if he is lying

8.Abdel Haleem: punishment shall be averted from his wife if she in turn four times calls God to witness that her husband is lyin

9.Abdel Haleem: and, the fifth time, calls God to reject her if he is telling the truth

10.Abdel Haleem: If it were not for God’s bounty and mercy towards you, if it were not that God accepts repentance and is wise . . .

11.Abdel Haleem: It was a group from among you that concocted the lie––do not consider it a bad thing for you [people]; it was a good thing––and every one of them will be charged with the sin he has earned. He who took the greatest part in it will have a painful punishment

12.Abdel Haleem: When you heard the lie, why did believing men and women not think well of their own people and declare, ‘This is obviously a lie’

13.Abdel Haleem: And why did the accusers not bring four witnesses to it? If they cannot produce such witnesses, they are the liars in God’s eyes

14.Abdel Haleem: If it were not for God’s bounty and mercy towards you in this world and the next, you would already have been afflicted by terrible suffering for indulging in such talk

15.Abdel Haleem: When you took it up with your tongues, and spoke with your mouths things you did not know [to be true], you thought it was trivial but to God it was very serious

16.Abdel Haleem: When you heard the lie, why did you not say, ‘We should not repeat this- God forbid!- It is a monstrous slander’

17.Abdel Haleem: God warns you never to do anything like this again, if you are true believers

18.Abdel Haleem: God makes His messages clear to you: God is all knowing, all wise

19.Abdel Haleem: A painful punishment waits in this world and the next for those who like indecency to spread among the believers: God knows and you do not

20.Abdel Haleem: If it were not for God’s bounty and mercy and the fact that He is compassionate and merciful . . .

21.Abdel Haleem: Believers, do not follow in Satan’s footsteps- if you do so, he will urge you to indecency and evil. If it were not for God’s bounty and mercy towards you, not one of you would ever have attained purity. God purifies whoever He will: God is all hearing, all seeing

22.Abdel Haleem: Those who have been graced with bounty and plenty should not swear that they will [no longer] give to kinsmen, the poor, those who emigrated in God’s way: let them pardon and forgive. Do you not wish that God should forgive you? God is most forgiving and merciful

23.Abdel Haleem: Those who accuse honourable but unwary believing women are rejected by God, in this life and the next. A painful punishment awaits the

24.Abdel Haleem: on the Day when their own tongues, hands, and feet will testify against them about what they have done

25.Abdel Haleem: on that Day, God will pay them their just due in full- and they will realize that God is the Truth that makes everything clear

26.Abdel Haleem: Corrupt women are for corrupt men, and corrupt men are for corrupt women; good women are for good men and good men are for good women. The good are innocent of what has been said against them; they will have forgiveness and a generous provision

27.Abdel Haleem: Believers, do not enter other people’s houses until you have asked permission to do so and greeted those inside- that is best for you: perhaps you will bear this in mind

28.Abdel Haleem: If you find no one in, do not enter unless you have been given permission to do so. If you are told, ‘Go away’, then do so- that is more proper for you. God knows well what you do

29.Abdel Haleem: You will not be blamed for entering houses where no one lives, and which could provide you with some useful service. God knows everything you do openly and everything you conceal

30.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], tell believing men to lower their glances and guard their private parts: that is purer for them. God is well aware of everything they do

31.Abdel Haleem: And tell believing women that they should lower their glances, guard their private parts, and not display their charms beyond what [it is acceptable] to reveal; they should let their headscarves fall to cover their necklines and not reveal their charms except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands’ fathers, their sons, their husbands’ sons, their brothers, their brothers’ sons, their sisters’ sons, their womenfolk, their slaves, such men as attend them who have no sexual desire, or children who are not yet aware of women’s nakedness; they should not stamp their feet so as to draw attention to any hidden charms. Believers, all of you, turn to God so that you may prosper

32.Abdel Haleem: Marry off the single among you and those of your male and female slaves who are fit [for marriage]. If they are poor, God will provide for them from His bounty: God’s bounty is infinite and He is all knowing

33.Abdel Haleem: Those who are unable to marry should keep chaste until God gives them enough out of His bounty. If any of your slaves wish to pay for their freedom, make a contract with them accordingly, if you know they have good in them, and give them some of the wealth God has given you. Do not force your slave-girls into prostitution, when they themselves wish to remain honourable, in your quest for the short-term gains of this world, although, if they are forced, God will be forgiving and merciful to them

34.Abdel Haleem: We have sent verses down to you [people] clarifying the right path, examples of those who passed away before you, and advice for those who are mindful of God

35.Abdel Haleem: God is the Light of the heavens and earth. His Light is like this: there is a niche, and in it a lamp, the lamp inside a glass, a glass like a glittering star, fuelled from a blessed olive tree from neither east nor west, whose oil almost gives light even when no fire touches it- light upon light- God guides whoever He will to his Light; God draws such comparisons for people; God has full knowledge of everything

36.Abdel Haleem: shining out in houses of worship. God has ordained that they be raised high and that His name be remembered in them, with men in them celebrating His glory morning and evening

37.Abdel Haleem: men who are not distracted, either by commerce or profit, from remembering God, keeping up the prayer, and paying the prescribed alms, fearing a day when hearts and eyes will turn over

38.Abdel Haleem: God will reward such people according to the best of their actions, and He will give them more of His bounty: God provides limitlessly for anyone He will

39.Abdel Haleem: But the deeds of those who disbelieve are like a mirage in a desert: the thirsty person thinks there will be water but, when he gets there, he finds only God, who pays him his account in full- God is swift in reckoning

40.Abdel Haleem: Or like shadows in a deep sea covered by wave upon wave, with clouds above- layer upon layer of darkness- if he holds out his hand, he is scarcely able to see it. The one to whom God gives no light has no light at all

41.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], do you not see that all those who are in the heavens and earth praise God, as do the birds with wings outstretched? Each knows its [own way] of prayer and glorification: God has full knowledge of what they do

42.Abdel Haleem: Control of the heavens and earth belongs to God: and to God is the final return

43.Abdel Haleem: Do you not see that God drives the clouds, then gathers them together and piles them up until you see rain pour from their midst? He sends hail down from [such] mountains in the sky, pouring it on whoever He wishes and diverting it from whoever He wishes- the flash of its lightning almost snatches sight away

44.Abdel Haleem: God alternates night and day- there truly is a lesson in [all] this for those who have eyes to see

45.Abdel Haleem: and God created each animal out of [its own] fluid: some of them crawl on their bellies, some walk on two legs, and some on four. God creates whatever He will; God has power over everything

46.Abdel Haleem: We have sent verses that clarify the right path: God guides whoever He will to a straight path

47.Abdel Haleem: They say, ‘We believe in God and the Messenger; we obey,’ but then some of them turn away: these people are not true believer

48.Abdel Haleem: and when they are summoned to God and His Messenger in order for him to judge between them, some of them turn away

49.Abdel Haleem: If they were claiming their right, they would come willingly [to the Prophet]

50.Abdel Haleem: Do they have sickness in their hearts? Are they full of doubts? Do they fear that God and His Messenger might deal with them unjustly? No, it is they who are the unjust ones

51.Abdel Haleem: When the true believers are summoned to God and His Messenger in order for him to judge between them, they say, ‘We hear and we obey.’ These are the ones who will prosper

52.Abdel Haleem: whoever obeys God and His Messenger, stands in awe of God, and keeps his duty to Him will be triumphant

53.Abdel Haleem: [The others] solemnly swear by God that if you [Prophet] commanded them, they would march out. Tell them, ‘Do not swear: it is reasonable obedience that is required, and God is aware of everything you do.’

54.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘Obey God; obey the Messenger. If you turn away, [know that] he is responsible for the duty placed upon him, and you are responsible for the duty placed upon you. If you obey him, you will be rightly guided, but the Messenger’s duty is only to deliver the message clearly.’

55.Abdel Haleem: God has made a promise to those among you who believe and do good deeds: He will make them successors to the land, as He did those who came before them; He will empower the religion He has chosen for them; He will grant them security to replace their fear. ‘They will worship Me and not join anything with Me.’ Those who are defiant after that will be the rebels.

56.Abdel Haleem: [People], keep up the prayer, pay the prescribed alms, and obey the Messenger, so that you may be given mercy

57.Abdel Haleem: Do not think [Prophet] that the disbelievers can escape God on earth; the Fire will be their final home, an evil end

58.Abdel Haleem: Believers, your slaves and any who have not yet reached puberty should ask your permission to come in at three times of day: before the dawn prayer; when you lay your garments aside in the midday heat; and after the evening prayer. These are your three times for privacy; at other times, there is no blame on you or them if you move around each other freely. In this way God makes messages clear: God is all knowing, all wise

59.Abdel Haleem: When your children reach puberty, they should [always] ask your permission to enter, like their elders do. This is how God makes His messages clear to you: God is all knowing, all wise

60.Abdel Haleem: No blame will be attached to elderly women who are not hoping for sex, if they take off their outer garments without flaunting their charms, but it is preferable for them not to do this: God is all hearing, all seeing

61.Abdel Haleem: No blame will be attached to the blind, the lame, the sick.Whether you eat in your own houses, or those of your fathers, your mothers, your brothers, your sisters, your paternal uncles, your paternal aunts, your maternal uncles, your maternal aunts, houses you have the keys for, or any of your friends’ houses, you will not be blamed: you will not be blamed whether you eat in company or separately. When you enter any house, greet one another with a greeting of blessing and goodness as enjoined by God. This is how God makes His messages clear to you so that you may understand

62.Abdel Haleem: The true believers are those who believe in God and His Mes-senger, who, when they are gathered with him on a communal matter, do not depart until they have asked his permission- those who ask your permission [Prophet] are the ones who truly believe in God and His Messenger. When they ask your permission to attend to their private affairs, allow whoever you see fit and ask God to forgive them. God is most forgiving and merciful

63.Abdel Haleem: [People], do not regard the Messenger’s summons to you like one of you summoning another- God is well aware of those of you who steal away surreptitiously- and those who go against his order should beware lest a trial afflict them or they receive a painful punishment

64.Abdel Haleem: Everything in the heavens and earth belongs to God: He knows what state you are in- on the Day when all are returned to Him, He will tell them everything they have done- God has full knowledge of everything

1.Abdel Haleem: Exalted is He who has sent the Differentiator down to His servant so that it may be a warning to all people

2.Abdel Haleem: It is He who has control over the heavens and earth and has no offspring––no one shares control with Him––and who created all things and made them to an exact measure

3.Abdel Haleem: Yet the disbelievers take as their gods things beneath Him that create nothing, and are themselves created, that can neither harm nor help themselves, and have no control over death, life, or resurrection

4.Abdel Haleem: The disbelievers say, ‘This can only be a lie he has forged with the help of others’––they themselves have done great wrong and told lies–&ndash

5.Abdel Haleem: and they say, ‘It is just ancient fables, which he has had written down: they are dictated to him morning and evening.’

6.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘It was sent down by Him who knows the secrets of the heavens and earth. He is all forgiving, all merciful.’

7.Abdel Haleem: They also say, ‘What sort of messenger is this? He eats food and walks about in the marketplaces! Why has no angel been sent down to help him with his warnings

8.Abdel Haleem: Why has he not been given treasure or a garden to supply his food?’ and the evildoers say, ‘The man you follow is simply under a spell.’

9.Abdel Haleem: See what they think you are like! They have gone astray and cannot find the right way

10.Abdel Haleem: Exalted is He who can, if He wishes, give you better things than these: Gardens graced with flowing streams, and palaces too

11.Abdel Haleem: It is actually the coming of the Hour that they reject: We have prepared a blazing fire for those who reject the Hour

12.Abdel Haleem: When it sees them from a distance, they will hear it raging and roaring

13.Abdel Haleem: and when they are hurled into a narrow part of it, chained together, they will cry out for death

14.Abdel Haleem: ‘Do not cry out this day for one death, but for many.’

15.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘Which is better, this or the lasting Garden that those who are mindful of God have been promised as their reward and journey’s end?’

16.Abdel Haleem: There they will find everything they wish for, and there they will stay. [Prophet], this is a binding promise from your Lord

17.Abdel Haleem: On the Day He gathers them all together with those they worship beside Him, He will say, ‘Was it you [false gods] who led these creatures of Mine astray, or did they stray from the path by themselves?’

18.Abdel Haleem: They will say, ‘May You be exalted! We ourselves would never take masters other than You! But You granted them and their forefathers pleasures in this life, until they forgot Your Reminder and were ruined.’

19.Abdel Haleem: [God will say], ‘Now your gods have denounced what you say as lies: you cannot avoid the punishment; you will not get any help.’ If any of you commits such evil, We shall make him taste agonizing torment

20.Abdel Haleem: No messenger have We sent before you [Muhammad] who did not eat food and walk about in the marketplace. But We have made some of you a means of testing others- will you stand fast? Your Lord is always watching

21.Abdel Haleem: Those who do not fear to meet Us say, ‘Why are the angels not sent down to us?’ or ‘Why can we not see our Lord?’ They are too proud of themselves and too insolent

22.Abdel Haleem: There will be no good news for the guilty on the Day they see the angels. The angels will say, ‘You cannot cross the forbidden barrier,’

23.Abdel Haleem: and We shall turn to the deeds they have done and scatter them like dust

24.Abdel Haleem: But the companions in the Garden will have a better home on that Day, and a fairer place to rest

25.Abdel Haleem: On the Day when the sky and its clouds are split apart and the angels sent down in streams

26.Abdel Haleem: on that Day, true authority belongs to the Lord of Mercy. It will be a grievous Day for the disbelievers

27.Abdel Haleem: On that Day the evildoer will bite his own hand and say, ‘If only I had taken the same path as the Messenger

28.Abdel Haleem: Woe is me! If only I had not taken so and so as a friend

29.Abdel Haleem: he led me away from the Revelation after it reached me. Satan has always betrayed mankind.’

30.Abdel Haleem: The Messenger has said, ‘Lord, my people treat this Quran as something to be shunned,’

31.Abdel Haleem: but We have always appointed adversaries from the wicked, for every prophet: Your Lord is sufficient guide and helper

32.Abdel Haleem: The disbelievers also say, ‘Why was the Quran not sent down to him all at once?’ We sent it in this way to strengthen your heart [Prophet]; We gave it to you in gradual revelation

33.Abdel Haleem: They cannot put any argument to you without Our bringing you the truth and the best explanation

34.Abdel Haleem: It is those driven [falling], on their faces,to Hell who will be in the worst place- they are the furthest from the right path

35.Abdel Haleem: We gave Moses the Book and appointed his brother Aaron to help him

36.Abdel Haleem: We said, ‘Go, both of you, to the people who have rejected Our signs.’ Later We destroyed those people utterly

37.Abdel Haleem: The people of Noah, too: when they rejected their messengers, We drowned them and made them an example to all people. We have prepared a painful torment for the evildoers

38.Abdel Haleem: as We did for the people of Ad, Thamud, and al-Rass, and many generations in between

39.Abdel Haleem: To each of them We gave warnings, and each of them We destroyed completely

40.Abdel Haleem: These disbelievers must have passed by the town that was destroyed by the terrible rain––did they not see it? Yet they do not expect to be raised from the dead

41.Abdel Haleem: Whenever they see you [Prophet] they ridicule you: ‘Is this the one God has sent as a messenger

42.Abdel Haleem: He might almost have led us astray from our gods if we had not stood so firmly by them.’ When they see the punishment, they will know who is furthest from the path

43.Abdel Haleem: Think [Prophet] of the man who has taken his own passion as a god: are you to be his guardian

44.Abdel Haleem: Do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are just like cattle- no, they are further from the path

45.Abdel Haleem: Do you not see how your Lord lengthens the shade? If He had willed, He could have made it stand still- We made the sun its indicator

46.Abdel Haleem: but We gradually draw it towards Us, little by little

47.Abdel Haleem: It is He who made the night a garment for you, and sleep a rest, and made the day like a resurrection

48.Abdel Haleem: It is He who sends the winds as heralds of good news before His Mercy. We send down pure water from the sky

49.Abdel Haleem: so that We can revive a dead land with it, and We give it as a drink to many animals and people We have created

50.Abdel Haleem: Many times We have repeated this to people so that they might take heed, but most persist in their ingratitude

51.Abdel Haleem: If it had been Our will, We would have sent a warner to every town

52.Abdel Haleem: so do not give in to the disbelievers: strive hard against them with this Quran

53.Abdel Haleem: It is He who released the two bodies of flowing water, one sweet and fresh and the other salty and bitter, and put an insurmountable barrier between them

54.Abdel Haleem: It is He who creates human beings from fluid, then makes them kin by blood and marriage: your Lord is all powerful

55.Abdel Haleem: Yet instead of God they worship things that can neither benefit nor harm them: the disbeliever has always turned his back on his Lord

56.Abdel Haleem: We sent you only to give good news and warning

57.Abdel Haleem: Say, ‘I am not asking for any reward for it, but anyone who wishes should take a path to his Lord.’

58.Abdel Haleem: Put your trust in the Living [God] who never dies, and celebrate His praise. He knows the sins of His servants well enough

59.Abdel Haleem: it is He who created the heavens and earth and what is between them in six Days, and then established Himself on the throne- He is the Lord of Mercy; He is the Best Informed

60.Abdel Haleem: Yet when they are told, ‘Bow down before the Lord of Mercy,’ they say, ‘What is the Lord of Mercy? Should we bow down before anything you command?’ and they turn even further away

61.Abdel Haleem: Exalted is He who put constellations in the heavens, a radiant light, and an illuminating moon

62.Abdel Haleem: it is He who made the night and day follow each other- so anyone who wishes may be mindful or show gratitude

63.Abdel Haleem: The servants of the Lord of Mercy are those who walk humbly on the earth, and who, when the foolish address them, reply, ‘Peace’

64.Abdel Haleem: those who spend the night bowed down or standing, worshipping their Lord

65.Abdel Haleem: who plead, ‘Our Lord, turn away from us the suffering of Hell, for it is a dreadful torment to suffer

66.Abdel Haleem: It is an evil home, a foul resting place!’

67.Abdel Haleem: They are those who are neither wasteful nor niggardly when they spend, but keep to a just balance

68.Abdel Haleem: those who never invoke any other deity beside God, nor take a life, which God has made sacred, except in the pursuit of justice, nor commit adultery. (Whoever does these things will face the penalties

69.Abdel Haleem: their torment will be doubled on the Day of Resurrection, and they will remain in torment, disgraced

70.Abdel Haleem: except those who repent, believe, and do good deeds: God will change the evil deeds of such people into good ones. He is most forgiving, most merciful

71.Abdel Haleem: People who repent and do good deeds truly return to God.

72.Abdel Haleem: [The servants of the Lord of Mercy are] those who do not give false testimony, and who, when they see some frivolity, pass by with dignity

73.Abdel Haleem: who, when reminded of their Lord’s signs, do not turn a deaf ear and a blind eye to them

74.Abdel Haleem: those who pray, ‘Our Lord, give us joy in our spouses and offspring. Make us good examples to those who are aware of You’

75.Abdel Haleem: These servants will be rewarded with the highest place in Paradise for their steadfastness. There they will be met with greetings and peace

76.Abdel Haleem: There they will stay- a happy home and resting place

77.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet, tell the disbelievers], ‘What are you to my Lord without your supplication? But since you have written offthe truth as lies, the inevitable will happen.’

1.Abdel Haleem: Ta Sin Mi

2.Abdel Haleem: These are the verses of the Scripture that makes things clear

3.Abdel Haleem: [Prophet], are you going to worry yourself to death because they will not believe

4.Abdel Haleem: If We had wished, We could have sent them down a sign from heaven, at which their necks would stay bowed in utter humility

5.Abdel Haleem: Whenever they are brought a new revelation from the Lord of Mercy, they turn away

6.Abdel Haleem: they deny it, but the truth of what they scorned will soon hit them

7.Abdel Haleem: Do they not see the earth, and what noble kinds of thing We grow in it

8.Abdel Haleem: There truly is a sign in this, though most of them do not believe

9.Abdel Haleem: your Lord alone is the Almighty, the Merciful

10.Abdel Haleem: Your Lord called to Moses: ‘Go to those wrongdoers

11.Abdel Haleem: the people of Pharaoh. Will they not take heed?’

12.Abdel Haleem: Moses said, ‘My Lord, I fear they will call me a liar

13.Abdel Haleem: and I will feel stressed and tongue-tied, so send Aaron too

14.Abdel Haleem: besides, they have a chargeagainst me, and I fear they may kill me.’

15.Abdel Haleem: God said, ‘No [they will not]. Go, both of you, with Our signs––We shall be with you, listen-ing

16.Abdel Haleem: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh and say, “We bring a message from the Lord of the Worlds

17.Abdel Haleem: let the Children of Israel leave with us.” ’

18.Abdel Haleem: Pharaoh said, ‘Did we not bring you up as a child among us? Did you not stay with us for many years

19.Abdel Haleem: And then you committed that crime of yours: you were so ungrateful.’

20.Abdel Haleem: Moses replied, ‘I was misguided when I did i

21.Abdel Haleem: and I fled from you in fear; later my Lord gave me wisdom and made me one of His messengers

22.Abdel Haleem: And is this- that you have enslaved the Children of Israel- the favour with which you reproach me?’

23.Abdel Haleem: Pharaoh asked, ‘What is this “Lord of the Worlds”?&rsquo

24.Abdel Haleem: Moses replied, ‘He is the Lord of the heavens and earth and everything between them. If you would only have faith!’

25.Abdel Haleem: Pharaoh said to those present, ‘Do you hear what he says?’

26.Abdel Haleem: Moses said, ‘He is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.’

27.Abdel Haleem: Pharaoh said, ‘This messenger who has been sent to you is truly possessed.’

28.Abdel Haleem: Moses continued, ‘Lord of the East and West and everything between them. If you would only use your reason!’

29.Abdel Haleem: But Pharaoh said [to him], ‘If you take any god other than me, I will throw you into prison,’

30.Abdel Haleem: and Moses asked, ‘Even if I show you something convincing?’

31.Abdel Haleem: ‘Show it then,’ said Pharaoh, ‘if you are telling the truth.’

32.Abdel Haleem: So Moses threw down his staff and- lo and behold!- it became a snake for everyone to see

33.Abdel Haleem: Then he drew out his hand and- lo and behold!- it was white for the onlookers to see

34.Abdel Haleem: Pharaoh said to the counsellors around him, ‘This man is a learned sorcerer

35.Abdel Haleem: He means to use his sorcery to drive you out of your land! What do you suggest?’

36.Abdel Haleem: They answered, ‘Delay him and his brother for a while, and send messengers to all the citie

37.Abdel Haleem: to bring every accomplished sorcerer to you.’

38.Abdel Haleem: The sorcerers were [to be] assembled at the appointed time on a certain da

39.Abdel Haleem: and the people were asked

40.Abdel Haleem: ‘Are you all coming? We may follow the sorcerers if they win!’

41.Abdel Haleem: When the sorcerers came, they said to Pharaoh, ‘Shall we be rewarded if we win?’

42.Abdel Haleem: and he said, ‘Yes, and you will join my inner court.’

43.Abdel Haleem: Moses said to them, ‘Throw down whatever you will.’

44.Abdel Haleem: They threw their ropes and staffs, saying, ‘By Pharaoh’s might, we shall be victorious.’

45.Abdel Haleem: But Moses threw his staff and- lo and behold!- it swallowed up their tricker

46.Abdel Haleem: and the sorcerers fell down on their knees

47.Abdel Haleem: exclaiming, ‘We believe in the Lord of the Worlds

48.Abdel Haleem: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.’

49.Abdel Haleem: Pharaoh said, ‘How dare you believe in him before I have given you permission? He must be the master who taught you sorcery! Soon you will see: I will cut off your alternate hands and feet and then crucify the lot of you!’

50.Abdel Haleem: ‘That will do us no harm,’ they said, ‘for we are sure to return to our Lord

51.Abdel Haleem: We hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, as we were the first to believe.’

52.Abdel Haleem: Then We revealed Our will to Moses, ‘Leave with My servants by night, for you will be pursued!’

53.Abdel Haleem: Pharaoh sent messengers into the cities, proclaiming

54.Abdel Haleem: ‘These people are a puny band–&ndash

55.Abdel Haleem: they have enraged us

56.Abdel Haleem: and we are a large army, on the alert.’

57.Abdel Haleem: So it was that We made them leave their gardens and their springs

58.Abdel Haleem: their treasures and their noble dwellings

59.Abdel Haleem: We gave [such] things [later]to the Children of Israel

60.Abdel Haleem: Pharaoh and his people pursued them at sunrise

61.Abdel Haleem: and as soon as the two sides came within sight of one another, Moses’ followers said, ‘We shall definitely be caught.’

62.Abdel Haleem: Moses said, ‘No, my Lord is with me: He will guide me,’

63.Abdel Haleem: and We revealed to Moses: ‘Strike the sea with your staff.’ It parted- each side like a mighty mountain

64.Abdel Haleem: and We brought the others to that place

65.Abdel Haleem: We saved Moses and all his companions

66.Abdel Haleem: and drowned the rest

67.Abdel Haleem: There truly is a sign in this, though most of them do not believe

68.Abdel Haleem: your Lord alone is the Almighty, the Merciful

69.Abdel Haleem: Tell them the story of Abraham

70.Abdel Haleem: when he asked his father and his people, ‘What do you worship?’

71.Abdel Haleem: They said, ‘We worship idols, and are constantly in attendance on them.’

72.Abdel Haleem: He asked, ‘Do they hear you when you call

73.Abdel Haleem: Do they help or harm you?’

74.Abdel Haleem: They replied, ‘No, but this is what we saw our fathers doing.’

75.Abdel Haleem: Abraham said, ‘Those idols you have worshipped

76.Abdel Haleem: you and your forefathers

77.Abdel Haleem: are my enemies; not so the Lord of the Worlds

78.Abdel Haleem: who created me. It is He who guides me

79.Abdel Haleem: He who gives me food and drink

80.Abdel Haleem: He who cures me when I am ill

81.Abdel Haleem: He who will make me die and then give me life again

82.Abdel Haleem: and He who will, I hope, forgive my faults on the Day of Judgement

83.Abdel Haleem: My Lord, grant me wisdom; join me with the righteous

84.Abdel Haleem: give me a good name among later generations

85.Abdel Haleem: make me one of those given the Garden of Bliss

86.Abdel Haleem: forgive my father, for he is one of those who have gone astray

87.Abdel Haleem: and do not disgrace me on the Day when all people are resurrected

88.Abdel Haleem: the Day when neither wealth nor children can help

89.Abdel Haleem: when the only one who will be saved is the one who comes before God with a heart devoted to Him.’

90.Abdel Haleem: When the Garden is brought near to the righteou

91.Abdel Haleem: and the Fire is placed in full view of the misguided

92.Abdel Haleem: it will be said to them, ‘Where are those you worshipped

93.Abdel Haleem: beside God? Can they help you now, or even help themselves?’

94.Abdel Haleem: and then they will all be hurled into Hell, together with those that misled them

95.Abdel Haleem: and all Iblis’s supporters

96.Abdel Haleem: There they will say to their gods, as they bicker among themselves

97.Abdel Haleem: ‘We were clearly misguide

98.Abdel Haleem: when we made you equal with the Lord of the Worlds

99.Abdel Haleem: It was the evildoers who led us astray

100.Abdel Haleem: and now we have no intercesso

102.Abdel Haleem: If only we could live our lives again, we would be true believers!’

103.Abdel Haleem: There truly is a sign in this, though most of them do not believe

104.Abdel Haleem: your Lord alone is the Almighty, the Merciful

105.Abdel Haleem: The people of Noah, too, called the messengers liars

106.Abdel Haleem: Their brother Noah said to them, ‘Will you not be mindful of God

107.Abdel Haleem: I am a faithful messenger sent to you

108.Abdel Haleem: be mindful of God and obey me

109.Abdel Haleem: I ask no reward of you, for my only reward is with the Lord of the Worlds

110.Abdel Haleem: be mindful of God and obey me.’

111.Abdel Haleem: They answered, ‘Why should we believe you when the worst sort of people follow you?’

112.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘What knowledge do I have of what they used to do

113.Abdel Haleem: It is for my Lord alone to bring them to account- if only you could see

114.Abdel Haleem: I will not drive believers away

115.Abdel Haleem: I am here only to give people a clear warning.’

116.Abdel Haleem: So they said, ‘Noah, if you do not stop this, you will be stoned.’

117.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘My Lord, my people have rejected me

118.Abdel Haleem: so make a firm judgement between me and them, and save me and my believing followers.’

119.Abdel Haleem: So We saved him and his followers in the fully laden ship

121.Abdel Haleem: There truly is a sign in this, though most of them do not believe

122.Abdel Haleem: your Lord alone is the Almighty, the Merciful

123.Abdel Haleem: The people of Ad, too, called the messengers liars

124.Abdel Haleem: Their brother Hud said to them, ‘Will you not be mindful of God

125.Abdel Haleem: I am a faithful messenger sent to you

126.Abdel Haleem: be mindful of God and obey me

127.Abdel Haleem: I ask no reward of you, for my only reward is with the Lord of the Worlds

128.Abdel Haleem: How can you be so vain that you set up monuments on every high place

129.Abdel Haleem: Do you build fortresses because you hope to be immortal

130.Abdel Haleem: Why do you act like tyrants whenever you attack someone

131.Abdel Haleem: Be mindful of God and obey me

132.Abdel Haleem: be mindful of Him who has provided you with everything you know

133.Abdel Haleem: He has given you livestock, sons

135.Abdel Haleem: for I truly fear that the torment of a grievous day will overtake you.’

136.Abdel Haleem: They replied, ‘It makes no difference to us whether you warn us or not

137.Abdel Haleem: for we only do what our forefathers used to do

139.Abdel Haleem: They denounced him as a liar, and so We destroyed them. There truly is a sign in this, though most of them do not believe

140.Abdel Haleem: your Lord alone is the Almighty, the Merciful

141.Abdel Haleem: The people of Thamud, too, called the messengers liars

142.Abdel Haleem: Their brother Salih said to them, ‘Will you not be mindful of God

143.Abdel Haleem: I am a faithful messenger to you

144.Abdel Haleem: be mindful of God and obey me

145.Abdel Haleem: I ask no reward from you, for my only reward is with the Lord of the Worlds

146.Abdel Haleem: [Do you think] you will be left secure for ever in what you have here

148.Abdel Haleem: fields, palm trees laden with fruit

149.Abdel Haleem: carving your fine houses from the mountains

150.Abdel Haleem: Be mindful of God and obey me

151.Abdel Haleem: do not obey those who are given to exces

152.Abdel Haleem: and who spread corruption in the land instead of doing what is right.’

154.Abdel Haleem: You are nothing but a man like us. Show us a sign, if you are telling the truth.’

155.Abdel Haleem: He said, ‘Here is a camel. She should have her turn to drink and so should you, each on a specified day

14.Abdel Haleem: They denied them, in their wickedness and their pride, even though their souls acknowledged them as true. See how those who spread corruption met their end

16.Abdel Haleem: Solomon succeeded David. He said, ‘People, we have been taught the speech of birds, and we have been given a share of everything: this is a clearly a great favour.’

17.Abdel Haleem: Solomon’s hosts of jinn, men, and birds were marshalled in ordered ranks before him

18.Abdel Haleem: and when they came to the Valley of the Ants, one ant said, ‘Ants! Go into your homes, in case Solomon and his hosts unwittingly crush you.’

19.Abdel Haleem: Solomon smiled broadly at her words and said, ‘Lord, inspire me to be thankful for the blessings You have granted me and my parents, and to do good deeds that please You; admit me by Your grace into the ranks of Your righteous servants.’

20.Abdel Haleem: Solomon inspected the birds and said, ‘Why do I not see the hoopoe? Is he absent

21.Abdel Haleem: I will punish him severely, or kill him, unless he brings me a convincing excuse for his absence.’

22.Abdel Haleem: But the hoopoe did not stay away long: he came and said, ‘I have learned something you did not know: I come to you from Sheba with firm news

23.Abdel Haleem: I found a woman ruling over the people, who has been given a share of everything- she has a magnificent throne

24.Abdel Haleem: [but] I found that she and her people worshipped the sun instead of God. Satan has made their deeds seem alluring to them, and diverted them from the right path: they cannot find the right path

25.Abdel Haleem: Should they not worship God, who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and earth and knows both what you people conceal and what you declare

26.Abdel Haleem: He is God, there is no god but Him, the Lord of the mighty throne.’

27.Abdel Haleem: Solomon said, ‘We shall see whether you are telling the truth or lying

28.Abdel Haleem: Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them, then withdraw and see what answer they send back.’

29.Abdel Haleem: The Queen of Sheba said, ‘Counsellors, a gracious letter has been delivered to me

30.Abdel Haleem: It is from Solomon, and it says, “In the name of God, the Lord of Mercy, the Giver of Mercy

31.Abdel Haleem: do not put yourselves above me, and come to me in submission to God.”&rsquo

35.Abdel Haleem: but I am going to send them a gift, then see what answer my envoys bring back.’

Solomon explained, ‘It is just a hall paved with glass,’ and she said, ‘My Lord, I have wronged myself: I devote myself, with Solomon, to God, the Lord of the Worlds.’

5.Abdel Haleem: but We wished to favour those who were oppressed in that land, to make them leaders, the ones to survive

6.Abdel Haleem: to establish them in the land, and through them show Pharaoh, Haman, and their armies the very thing they feared

9.Abdel Haleem: and Pharaoh’s wife said, ‘Here is a joy to behold for me and for you! Do not kill him: he may be of use to us, or we may adopt him as a son.’ They did not realize what they were doing

10.Abdel Haleem: The next day, Moses’ mother felt a void in her heart––if We had not strengthened it to make her one of those who believe, she would have revealed everything about him–&ndash

11.Abdel Haleem: and she said to his sister, ‘Follow him.’ So she watched him from a distance, without them knowing

12.Abdel Haleem: We had ordained that he would refuse to feed from wet nurses. His sister approached them and said, ‘Shall I tell you about a household which could bring him up for you and take good care of him?’
